author: {'steamid': '76561199472547165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1678558456}
review: For those who are looking for a single player game, this is not the game they are looking for because it is an online game. Since there were no players, we were able to have fun with a group of friends for a while. But even though I have a very good system, I often experienced FPS drops and performance problems. Obviously, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone because there are no players, but if you have a group of friends and you are looking for a different shooter game, you can try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1667772938}
review:
"Down To One" ist ein First-Person Multiplayer-Shooter.

Einige Spieler starten auf einer Karte, mÃ¼ssen Waffen, Munition, Nahrung und Wasser finden und sammeln und sich dann in einem immer kleiner werdenden Gebiet gegenseitig bekÃ¤mpfen bis nur noch ein letzter Ãœberlebender Ã¼brig bleibt. 

Klingt nach einem typischen Multiplayer, einem inzwischen ausgelutschten Genre. Und genau das ist es auch, allerdings in grottigem, vÃ¶llig kaputtem Zustand. Wahrscheinlich spielt deswegen niemand diesen Haufen DatenmÃ¼ll. 

 So gut wie nichts funktioniert richtig, alles wirkt als sein es noch in einem Pre-Alpha Zustand steckengeblieben. Zum Beispiel sollte man es besser vermeiden, auf einen Wachturm zu klettern, denn nach den Ã¤uÃŸerst hakeligen Steigbewegungen, bei denen man offenbar einen Teil der Animation vergessen hat, ist die Wahrscheinlichkeit sehr groÃŸ, das man einfach den gesamten Weg wieder runterfÃ¤llt und die Plattform gar nicht erreicht. 

Auch ansonsten wirkt alles ungelenk, freezes sind an der Tagesordnung, gern bleibt man irgendwo hÃ¤ngen und das Waffenhandling ist unangenehm. Die Grafik ist auf typisch schwachem Niveau solcher Billig-Spiele, hÃ¤ufig ploppen Objekte einfach so im Blickfeld auf. Ohnehin scheint Vieles aus Assett-Sets zusammengesucht, teilweise passen einige Objekte in Bezug auf die Proportionen gar nicht in die Welt. So liegt zum Beispiel ein Flugzeugwrack in der Gegend rum, in das der Spieler selbst mit viel Liebe nicht mal ansatzweise reinpassen wÃ¼rde. 

Aber der furchtbare Zustand des Spiels ist eben gar nicht das Schlimmste. Viel problematischer ist, daÃŸ - vÃ¶llig zu recht - niemand diesen MÃ¼ll spielt und man allein in der leeren Welt blÃ¶d rumsteht. So etwas braucht wirklich niemand. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
1/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
-/10 Story
3/10 Grafik
2/10 Sound
1/10 Spielmechanik
0/10 Balancing
0/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Stellt Euch vor, es gibt ein Multiplayer-Match und keiner geht hin. Auch die Wertung ist "Down to One". 

[h1][b]1/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198009655414', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1655348826}
review: Came to check the game out after like 6 years of forgetting it was even in my library. Obviously I only had 15 minutes at the time and remembered it was because I literally couldn't get this Unity game to launch and when it did finally work, I was in a lobby with just me and my friend. Saw that the dev's posted an update a little over a month ago from the time of this review and figured I'd give it a shot. It immediately crashed upon trying to launch it from Steam. Said it couldn't even find the .exe file lmao. Went to the installation folder and found the application and actually got it launch. Obviously there's no servers though so I tried to launch a single player world just to check out the map finally and it crashed. Tried about 3 more times and gave up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009751161', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1652486092}
review:
Down to One is finally back and it came back swinging!! The blazing fast Unity Engine shows what a game is meant to feel like. The controls are responsive and crisp and the environments are as pretty as ever. 
Get ready for a huge nostalgia eruption once you enter the world of Down to One!!! 
(You will have to rename the .exe and two folders for the game to even start)

author: {'steamid': '76561198866942343', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1633005093}
review:
"Dedicated Servers: Don't settle for games hosted on someone's dial-up. Our high performance dedicated servers will make multiplayer feel like you're at a LAN."

That quote from the game's description is enough to show how many fucks this company / individual / band of thieves gave about ensuring their game had any longevity after an initial flood of revenue and players. No available servers, single player mode, or ability to host a server = no playable game. Still offered for sale, so if you have $0.99 + applicable taxes that you want to waste, feel free to purchase. Who knows -- maybe in 3 more years they will have a short-lived beta again where the players who purchased it can play?

Definitely not recommended. I'll revisit in a year to see if anything has changed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1562004189}
review:
[h1] Game Summary: [/h1] 
This is a battle royale game, which has been growing in popularity the last few years due to the successes of titles such as Overwatch, Fortnite, Apex, etc.  Unlike many games I review though, I have almost nothing to comment on because of a cardinal flaw with these games.  They rely on a constant player base in order for people to play the game at all.  This can work, when it taps into a player base millions of people strong, so that there's always a few thousand people on at any given time.  This game was in the store back in January 2016, and as of July 2019, there's nobody who is online anymore.  That seemed to be true even as far back as 2018.  Based on other reviews, the developers dropped the price down to $1, trying to maintain a player base, but the game is already dead at this point.  Therefore, I cannot  play the game, as there's no single-player features or modes.  There's not even a training or practice mode for me to see how the mechanics work out.


[h1] Pros: [/h1] 
	â€¢ I have no idea, as I can't play the game.  My playtime stems from checking for an active server (never found one), and grinding for the trading cards.


[h1] Cons: [/h1] 
	â€¢ From what I saw under the control options, there wasn't a way to play with a controller.  Personally, I can't play shooting games without a controller.  I know that makes me a scrub, but it is what it is.  
	â€¢ No offline features, such as a practice mode, to develop skills and familiarity with the game.  Let alone play by yourself when no one else is available, let alone 40 total players.
	â€¢ There's no player base to support this title, so it's no longer a functional game.  


[h1] Conclusion: [/h1] 
The strong negative reviews seem to come from two main areas.  The first stem from those who did have the chance to try this game, and found it to be interesting initially, but failed to deliver on its ideas.  They were close, but no cigar.  The other come from those players like me.  People who have the game in their libraries, decided to try it out at some point, and found that the game was already abandoned.  No matter how amazing the game might have been, without a way to play it, it's completely worthless.  I cannot recommend this game, especially as I'm dubious it would ever have a revival.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014763908', 'num_games_owned': 2519, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1467638854}
review:
You require 42 players to play a game, the all-time peak is 246 players, and it has not gotten close to that number ever again, the closest is 94 players, closest after that is 59 players, then it drops all the way down to 20 players.

Average daily peak players the last 3 years is about 5 players.

I guess this is an informational review to let you know that this game is dead and was only playable for 3 months out of the almost 5 years it's been on Steam, including the 1 year long Early Access period it had from January 2015 to December 2015.


[h1]Curator page[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or otherwise found it helpful in deciding whether or not to buy this game, feel free to follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/29162366/]my Curator page[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970064749', 'num_games_owned': 5549, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1532898519}
review:
Many games like this have perished and many more will , so is the faith of Multiplayer-only games. 

Down To One had some nice ideas but failed to deliver. A lot of work was still needed but it took too long and players left. Even dropping the game to 1 Euro did not help. What remains is a main menu screen with no option to play the game since there are no servers and I don't think there is an option to host one either.

This game shouldn't be allowed to be sold anymore.

review:
Down To One was a battle royale game.
Up to 42 players were able to play in a match and were trying to be the last man standing.
This game never had a huge playerbase and was no competitor at all for games like H1Z1 King of the Kill back in time.
It was full of bugs, the weapon mechanics were weird and most importantly: It was no fun to play!
The games price was initialy 14,99 Euro and dropped down to 0,99 Euro to get more players into the game.
It worked for a while but after time the players have left the game again.
Do not waste money on it. There is no one to play with. It is completely dead.

Sounds 3/10
Graphics 3/10
Gameplay 2/10
Atmosphere 1/10

If you liked my review, please feel free to follow me and/or my curator group:
http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ov3RT4K3R/myworkshopfiles/?section=guides
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/orcollective#curation

Unlucky that i got a 4-pack back then i still have 2 copies im afraid to gift anyone cause the game is a hot mess.

Definitely dont buy this if its not only for your gamecount in the library. I wish i could just delete Games from my library but i guess this doesnt work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198279500543', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1586592993}
review: With a total of 12.7 hours on this game i must say i had alot of fun. Yes the servers are dead and have hardly anyone on them and only way you can play is with your friends which i did. There are many things you can do in this game buddy up with a friend and explore and find a sign with russian letters in it and procced to run through a line field. You could alsosit ontop of a mountain and watch one of your friends get harrassed by 7 rattle snakes. As for the gameplay i would rate it around a 6 out of 10. One amazing thing about the gameplay is that your always learning new things it could be how touse a sniper with no scope or you could accidently find out how to walk through walls and kill your friends. The game is also very tactical you have the abilitie to choose what camo to wear so you can blend into the enviroment, another tactical part about this game is the hiding system yes you can use your camo clothing to hide in the ground or you could just hidein one ofthe final buidlings and hide inside a desk draw and wait for the enemy to push you. Overall i believe the game is worth the money and could be worth more if the developers got back in and changed a few things like getting rid of the rattle snakes that kill you more often then players. This has been Doggers game review and i give this game 7 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036378965', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1516867926}
review:
Sometimes I think about my life and the choices I make, and get a bit dissapointed in myself, but then I just think about how awful the Devs of this game must feel.   This game is complete and utter trash.  I would be embarrased to have ANYTHING to do with its creation.  

There are no redeemable features, but there is a hideous menu with bloom so bright you'll squint, almost missing the typos in the settings ("AutJoin Servers" / "Feild of View")
There is no quirk or characteristic of this game that makes it worth the 5 minutes it takes to load into an empty server. 

"Did you want 1080p at 60hz? Too bad!  Here's 24hz instead! The only 60hz resolutions are under 1600x900 so you'd better get used to that!"  ................   "Sorry, the quit button doesn't do anything." .........  "Sorry, there's a single server that's perpetually empty, but you can stand around in a lobby with a ball that doesn't move"

I can't give any more of a review because that's EVERYTHING I was able to experience in the game.   An objectively ugly, disfuctional and unhelpful menu system, resolution bugs and graphical errors, before standing in an empty lobby about the size of a squash court with a non-functioning ball stuck to the floor.   I was unable to do anything else as a match requires the server to not be EMPTY.   I guess if you had friends that like playing awful games at awful resolutions or awful framerates, this might be something that should might consider.  

It's not worth spending ANY money on, let alone an entire dollar.  You could buy enough rope with that dollar to choke yourself, an event that would be at least twice as entertaining as this steaming pile of shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064377430', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1635, 'last_played': 1671353051}
review:
The single greatest game i have ever graced upon on steam. its like finding a cookie in a tin that you swore as a kid it was full of stupid shit but actually there is a cookie in it. or better yet, it is like finding what the meaning of life is in this horrible world that we live in today. i was just 16 years old when i played this game and over the time of me playing it i have developed into a mature young man who is a avid Down To One player and i cannot stress this enough, This. Is. It.

This game is like my blank canvas, only me to decide what i do and what i dont do and the sudden life or death situations that happen in this game are all gob smacking realistic. i cannot even fathom how great this game is. its in depth analysis on the weaponary is intriguing at the least. the realistic survival scenario is just way to much to take on board as a young adult and i feel as if it is just too real all the time. Over my time of playing this game i can safely say.



































screw sneks

review: This game is an "Early Access" disaster! Nowadays "Down To One" is an abandoned attempt to create an enjoyable battle royal multiplayer shooter. Now the players are gone, there aren't servers online and the developer ... - but who cares? ;)

review: Thought id review this game after the hype died, although it died a long time ago, i must say, this game is fucking garbage, clunky, unoptimized, most unoriginal idea ever, nothing new to the table AT ALL. I looked at some of the Curators who gave this game a good review, there was one for 10/10, fuck off. These curators have to be the worst in history, fucking sellouts, absoloute jokes, look at the curators, dont follow them, waste of time. Anyway back to the game, its wank, BUT i love it. The reason i love it, is if you get some friends together to play this game, its possibly the most hillarious thing ever, i have not laughed so hard in my life playing this game. 79 Pence is a joke if you have no one to play this with, play this with friends and its priceless, thumbs up just for pure hillarity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026628872', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1532827242}
review:
It's just a down and dirty Battle Royale, what's there not to like? It's just a shame there is never anyone playing.

Pros
Pretty damn fun game when there's people to play it.
The weapons are pretty diverse in how they handle.
The talents make it so there's quite a few different ways to get a major or slight advantage over enemies.
It's like playing a survival game and a Battle Royale game at the same time.

Cons
The menu glitches out often.
When you choose to purchase a talent it doesn't let you select it until you restart the game, because of this you can purchase the same talent multiple times and waste your money.
No one plays the game.
Snakes are super loud and give away your position constantly.
The flies and their noise that occur on corpses doesn't happen when you play dead so it's an obvious giveaway, not necessarily a bad thing but kind of annoying when playing against people who know the game, so more of a personal gripe.

1/10 do not buy, unless updated and fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021050825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1493691589}
review:
So this randomly appeared in my libary. Now i have wanted this game for actual a small while. After launching it i can now, for the first time want my money back for a game i got for free. I dont even know how thats possible but i really want my 0.00$ back.

Kiddking aside this game is just, NO. I mean i dont have much room to talk due to me never actually being a match but thats kinda the problem. There are no servers or finding servers is broken. So yea thats a big problem... Then I go to quit but the actual quit button is just a decal. It does not even work. So yea thats kinda annoying. I could see this game maybe once had a vision and also just to see more bugs I clicked "report a bug". I type a somewhat lengthy bug report of the quit button and various other thins that were just off, then I go to send it and the button is also a decal. There was no way to send the bug report due to the bug report sending system being bugged. So i have to manually close it but that was even troublesome. TBH this game really reminds me of Ark (at early acesses launch) except if you took everything out but the buggy menu. So this game i must admit did provide some enjoyment but well not the right kind. If anyone does actually get into a game please tell me of the amazing bugs that will surely come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119546722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1490117516}
review:
The game really does live up to it's name, as it seems no one else touches this cheap, but still intresting looking ARMA like shooter. I mean fo 79p in the UK, that's pretty a good bagin for a game but the community is as joked above, Down to One.

I'd like to see this get some more attention, if the devs still care for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136157326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1479587107}
review:
Why?.......Oh why do you make me write a bad review? I'm a nice guy and rarely do I see or say negative things. This game? This game should still be in Early Access. It needs a hell of a lot of work. 
The concept was cool. Battle Royal type deal. Scavenge for weapons and food. Kill the competition. 
Problem is there is no competition. The one time I did manage to get in a match. I killed a guy and it crashes.
 There hasn't been any activity with this game since I bought it. No updates, nothing.
Here I bought a 4 pack of this game to give to my friends but I'm afraid to.

If this game somehow gets updates and becomes playable? I'll gladly change my review. 
In the meantime. My notion is it's abandoned. The devs have aborted this project. Leaving a sick and twisted piece of software to die on its own. Thumbed down to oblivion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018629981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1688253171}
review:
THIS GAME IS AWESOME, BUT NEEDS MORE UPDATES!

WHY GUYS? 
Down To One is a promising battle royale game, but it needs urgent new updates, before is too late! 

This is a highly bugged game and incomplete... But...
This game is an indie game, and for an indie team this is a big work!
The gameplay works well, is solid, the game is very funny, but it needs a lot of improvements and some additions.
The variety of weapons is very good, and the foods, survival, system is good too (better than H1Z1)!
A lot of bugs (some are serious) needs to be fixed because the gameplay and fun is seriously compromise. 

FOR THE DEVELOPERS:
I'm a developer too, I can understand the sorrow for an empty game and for a lot of negative reviews, but this is your fault.
Down To One is promising, the gameplay is solid, all bugs and gameplay mechanics can be and needs to be fixed and improving a lot, before release other projects, because other future projects sales will be damaged compromised for this conduct.
Please do not abandon this project, because it is solid and needs only finishing touches. This is an indie project i can understand!  
The players are angry because they feel abandoned without news of game developments..


FOR SAVE THE GAME FROM THE ABYSS AND REGAIN THE PLAYERS CONFIDENCE IS NEEDED:

     1) Return to Early Access, the game isn't finished!
     2) Update Unity 5.4 beta in 5.4.1 Stable, many crashes!
     3) Write news to explain the development state of the game (regular news)
     4) Updates every month (1.3, 1.4, 1.5...)
     5) Fixed various serious bugs as:
              5.1) Players can see through walls
              5.2) Transition from walking, running etc.. needs to be very quick
              5.3) The animations and the walking is too slow, it needs more balance
              5.4) Some wrong collider can block you from walking
              5.5) The "waiting arena" is boring, enlarge it and make more aesthetic objects
              5.6) Main menu buttons not respond well at mouse click
              5.7) Set Static Server list to default if this is to set every time
              5.8) The server list doesn't show number of player and ping (?/42, ?)  
              5.9) Exit Game button doesn't work
              5.10) Some video options (as shadow quality) miss its settings 
     
      6) Features needed for a modern and fun Battle Royale game:
              6.1) Player/weapons customization skin/accessories with a 3d model preview
              6.2) The Skill needs to be reworked
              6.3) After death you can give some skin/player customizations rewards, based on match rating
              6.4) Team play, to play better with friends
              6.5) Add more weapons (or same weapons but with different scopes/accessories)
              6.6) Add accessories for weapons (scope, silencer etc..)
              6.7) Rework and Enlarge the map
              6.8) Armors and helms to find
              6.9) backpack for increase items slots (start with only 3, 4 ,5)
              6.10) Add some vehicles (quad, motocycles, jeep?)
              6.11) 2 start match spawn:  1) random, 2) parachute
              6.12) Add more sounds, enviroment, player, weapons
              6.13) Add a portable map (optional with dome system) without player position and dome
              6.14) Planes Bombing Raid
              6.15) The Graphics and Textures need improvements (some are good, other are very bad)
              6.16) The Players Animations need improvements


I trust in you guys, please make one of the best Battle Royale game!
Down To One can become better than H1Z1, the gameplay is more complex and various, only needs some tweaks. 

Let's Develop Now!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997987206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1546719098}
review:
I really wish I could play this game. I bought a 4-pack with the intent of giving one to my brother, and one to our friend. I still have three in my inventory. I have actually never played a single match. I have tried about six times to play, and tonight there are LITERALLY ZERO SERVERS. The game is 100% dead. No matter the content of a game, if you cannot even play it, for any reason, I cannot recommend it in any way.

Sucks I can't get a refund, seeing how I was sold a game with no players, and no gameplay (if you don't count the main menu, and {empty} server list).

review:
Very good game, maybe the rounds are a bit short, you need too much luck to find a good weapon as you can only search a few houses before the wall arrives.

Unfortunately this game died pretty quick as it came out of nowhere and people just don't want to spend a dollar.
If it were free to play and sold skins, it would be a very active game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050272635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1469384669}
review:
Part 1
On the 16th of June, 1904, Stephen Dedalus and Leopold Bloom were both living in Dublin. Both differed from the people about them and walked in isolation among them because each was, according to his capacity, an intellectual adventurerâ€”Dedalus, the poet and philosopher, with a mind full of beautiful images and abstruse speculations and Bloom, the advertisement canvasser, in a more rudimentary fashion. In the evening, Mr. Bloom and Dedalus became involved in the same drunken party and Dedalus was knocked unconscious in a quarrel with a British soldier. Then their kinship was made plain. Bloom felt wistfully that Stephen was all he would have had his own son be and Stephen, who despised his own fatherâ€”an amiable wastrelâ€”found a sort of spiritual father in this sympathetic Jew, who, mediocre as he was, had at least the dignity of intelligence. Were they not both outlaws to their environment by reason of the fact that they thought and imagined ?

This is the story of Ulyssesâ€”an ironic and amusing anecdote without philosophic moral.

Stated in the baldest possible terms, this is the story of Ulyssesâ€”an ironic and amusing anecdote without philosophic moral. In describing the novel thus, I have the authority of the author himself, who said to Miss Djuna Barnes, in an interview published in Vanity Fair: â€œThe pity is the public will demand and find a moral in my bookâ€”or worse they may take it in some more serious way, and on the honor of a gentleman, there is not one single serious line in it.â€ The thing that makes Ulysses imposing is, in fact, not the theme but the scale upon which it is developed. It has taken Mr. Joyce seven years to write Ulysses and he has done it in seven hundred and thirty pages which are probably the most completely â€œwrittenâ€ pages to be seen in any novel since Flaubert. Not only is the anecdote expanded to its fullest possible bulkâ€”there is an elaborate account of nearly everything done or thought by Mr. Bloom from morning to night of the day in questionâ€”but you have both the â€œpsychologicalâ€ method and the Flaubertian method of making the style suit the thing described carried several steps further than they have ever been before, so that, whereas in Flaubert you have merely the words and cadences carefully adapted to convey the specific mood or character without any attempt to identify the narrative with the stream of consciousness of the person described, and in Henry James merely the exploration of the stream of consciousness with only one vocabulary and cadence for the whole cast of moods and characters, in Joyce you have not only life from the outside described with Flaubertian virtuosity but also the consciousness of each of the characters and of each of the characterâ€™s moods made to speak in the idiom proper to it, the language it uses to itself. If Flaubert taught de Maupassant to find the adjective which would distinguish a given hackney-cab from every other hackney-cab in the world, James Joyce has prescribed that one must find the dialect which would distinguish the thoughts of a given Dubliner from those of every other Dubliner. So we have the thoughts of Mr. Bloom presented in a rapid staccato notation continually jetting out in all directions in little ideas within ideas with the flexibility and complexity of an alert and nimble mind; Mrs. Bloomâ€™s in a long rhythmic brogue like the swell of some profound sea; Father Conmeeâ€™s in precise prose, perfectly colorless and orderly; Stephen Dedalusâ€™s in a kaleidoscope of bright images and fragments of things remembered from books; and Gerty-Nausicaaâ€™s half in school girl colloquialisms and half in the language of the cheap romances which have given their color to her mind. And these voices are used to record all the eddies and stagnancies of thought; though exercising a severe selection which makes the book a technical triumph, Mr. Joyce manages to give the effect of unedited human minds, drifting aimlessly along from one triviality to another, confused and diverted by memory, by sensation and by inhibition. It is, in short, perhaps the most faithful X-ray ever taken of the ordinary human consciousness.

It is, in short, perhaps the most faithful X-ray ever taken of the ordinary human consciousness.
And as a result of this enormous scale and this microscopic fidelity the chief characters in Ulysses take on heroic proportions. Each one is a room, a house, a city in which the reader can move around. The inside of each one of them is a novel in itself. You stand within a world infinitely populated with the swarming life of experience. Stephen Dedalus, in his scornful pride, rears his brow as a sort of Lucifer; poor Bloom, with his generous impulses and his attempts to understand and master life, is the epic symbol of reasoning man, humiliated and ridiculous, yet extricating himself by cunning from the spirits which seek to destroy him; and Mrs. Bloom, with her terrific force of mingled amorous and maternal affection, with her roots in the dirt of the earth and her joyous flowering in beauty, is the gigantic image of the earth itself from which both Dedalus and Bloom have sprung and which sounds a deep foundation to the whole drama like the ground-tone at the beginning of The Rhine-Gold. I cannot agree with Mr. Arnold Bennett that James Joyce â€œhas a colossal â€˜downâ€™ on humanity.â€ I feel that Mr. Bennett has really been shocked because Mr. Joyce has told the whole truth. Fundamentally Ulysses is not at all like Bouvard et PÃ©cuchet (as some people have tried to pretend). Flaubert says in effect that he will prove to you that humanity is mean by enumerating all the ignobilities of which it has ever been capable. But Joyce, including all the ignobilities, makes his bourgeois figures command our sympathy and respect by letting us see in them the throes of the human mind straining always to perpetuate and perfect itself and of the body always laboring and throbbing to throw up some beauty from its darkness.

Nonetheless, there are some valid criticisms to be brought against Ulysses. It seems to me great rather for the things that are in it than for its success as a whole. It is almost as if in distending the story to ten times its natural size he had finally managed to burst it and leave it partially deflated. There must be something wrong with a design which involves so much that is dullâ€”and I doubt whether anyone will defend parts of Ulysses against the charge of extreme dullness. In the first place, it is evidently not enough to have invented three tremendous characters (with any quantity of lesser ones); in order to produce an effective book they must be made to do something interesting. Now in precisely what is the interest of Ulysses supposed to consist? In the spiritual relationship between Dedalus and Bloom? But too little is done with this. When it is finally realized there is one poignant moment, then a vast tract of anticlimax. This single situation in itself could hardly justify the previous presentation of everything else that has happened to Bloom before on the same day. No, the major theme of the book is to he found in its parallel with the Odyssey: Bloom is a sort of modern Ulyssesâ€”with Dedalus as Telemachusâ€”and the scheme and proportions of the novel must be made to correspond to those of the epic. It is these and not the inherent necessities of the subject which have dictated the size and shape of Ulysses. You have, for example, the events of Mr. Bloomâ€™s day narrated at such unconscionable length and the account of Stephenâ€™s synchronous adventures confined almost entirely to the first three chapters because it is only the early books of the Odyssey which are concerned with Telemachus and thereafter the first half of the poem is devoted to the wanderings of Ulysses.

review: It's not as bad as a lot of people are saying, but it definitely needs some more work(esp graphics wise) and better promotion to grow the community. The game is completely playable IF you can find enough players to get a match started, otherwise you're just kicking a soccer ball around in a little box, waiting.  It's like playing a stripped down, poor man's version of H1Z1: King of the Kill but with the survival element intact and a much smaller map.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993651907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1565470284}
review:
i got the game for free so i feel really sorry for the person who buyed it for me and himself in hope to play it with me.

i FOUND a server with 3 people in it and loading took decent time even tho i was not sure did game just freeze or not,  i was willing to give this game a shot... heh... a shot, BECAUSE ALL I FOUND WAS A PILE OF FOOD  AND SOME BACKAGES WHAT WERE ACTUALLY BANDAGES.

when i finally found a knife, i felt like a king but soon i heard gun shots landing on the walls while i was inside, i saw nobody anyhow who would have done that.... oh and btw... ladders are a joke and how i solved it was just by spam jump up over the roof. 

the items are half way glitched inside ground, i was not able pick up pistol so i had to drop my knife in order to do that. while opening drawers i realised items are stuck back part of them so it's pain in ass to try get them from there... i was sniped by a pistol short after that and that is all.

i don't know who tough making pistols super accurate and long ranged weapons but yeah... hey at least i found way to glitch trough big red backgage to get item from inside it but all i got was a radio what did nothing for me more than took room from inventory. 

2/10 for trying at least little bit but not enough, don't buy the game as a even joke for someone because you just support the makers or maker... i don't fucking care.

This was gifted to me... and it is terrible. 
The graphics are ugly, and glitchy.  It is multiplayer only and the servers are dead.  There were literally 2 other people logged on, not enough to even start a match.  I feel sorry for anyone that was suckered into paying 15 bucks for this atrocity.  It was entertaining for a laugh, however.  

And the quit button on the menu is broken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135650516', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1638762672}
review:
My friend gifted this to me and I have to say this game is actually pretty good and has a lot of potential if more people played on the servers. When  you can get enought people on a server its super fun. Battle Royale is really good in this game. Deathmatch is also good in this game. I am now going to put a Pros and Cons list.

Pros:                                             
Decent Graphics                            
Battle Royale                                 
Deathmatch                                   
Fun 
A lot of perks for your character
Good Framerate (for me at least and I have a horrible pc)
Variety of Melee weapons and guns
You can play soccer (Football everywhere else)

Cons:
 Quit Button Doesn't work
 Most of the time servers are empty
 Bugs

That is all I can think of,But as you can see there are a lot more Pros than Cons.
I say buy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996890045', 'num_games_owned': 3060, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1466413574}
review:
The game Down To One could be ok, but I wouldn't know - as normally there is no-one in any of the servers available (and there are very few of those).

Down To One is well named, as the number of players in just about every server I've joined is down to one (namely, me).

Amazingly, today - for the first time ever - I found someone else in a server.
Mind you, it was a rubbish map, about the size of a large lounge room, with a soccer ball on the ground - I guess that you are supposed to play soccer rather than have a shooting game. The map was listed, in the "Environment" column of the server list, as "Middle-East". It was pathetic. Unless it is a pre-match area, but I wouldn't know - because I have never found enough people in a server to play a game.
Another person joined the server shortly afterwards, but he quit after about one minute (or less) - I don't blame him.
I reloaded the game to check something for this review. The server list said that there were three players in one server, but it was actually empty; I think it was the server I was in previously. This is typical; with one exception (noted above), whenever the server list has said someone is in a game, and I join, it's empty.

By the way, you have to change your settings in the game's loading box; most settings cannot be changed after the game is loaded (although some settings can be changed in-game).
The exit button on the start screen doesn't work (I have to Ctrl-Alt-Delete to get out of the game).
So, that's not too crash hot (no pun intended).

The servers are empty. The game is dead.
I cannot recommend a game which is deceased.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967132117', 'num_games_owned': 4622, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1482854090}
review:
had high hopes for this game ... sadly enough the longer i kept the game and the more i tried, the more disappointed i got...

the game itself is a great idea; but when there is no one to play with, and the occasional play is just a 1V1 then the game is dull and not fun at all... the marketing department for this game made some big errors ...

also about the pricing; some people paid 15 on greenlight, others paid 1 after the greenlight period; that's not fair; that's just jackpotting the greenlightsers. Also, a few months ago the game was in a bundle sale for even less money...

author: {'steamid': '76561198019147628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1791, 'last_played': 1536370418}
review:
I have owned this game for years now, bought it long before I knew about ARMA, let alone the Battlegrounds mod.  

This is clearly a single man project, and the creator is still active.  I believe this is simply a misguided concept, not a malicious cash grab.  After all this time the developer is still keeping us updated on their work and, you know, actually working on it.  If it were anything else they would have deserted it like so many others.

In the short amount of time I got to actually play the game, I managed to gather a few positives.  I like the handling and controls, firing has an appropriate weight behind it.  You have limited inventory space, even compared to other games in the genre.  Finding ammo for the gun you have is fortunate.  You can starve, or dehydrate, or get bit by a snake which makes camping a little more difficult.  While the playable zone shrinks it's not to the same harsh extent as in PUBG, so if you get screwed by it, you really screwed yourself.  You can choose between random spawns or the normal mode where you all spawn in a central hud.  There's also a pure deathmatch mode which is actually quite fun. You can climb things you should be able to climb.

There isn't much else to say that shouldn't be apparent.  It's sloppy.  Extremely difficult to actually play with other people due to the minuscule player population.  I know, I've been trying.

The fact is it's playable and less than a buck.  One day this will be a diamond, we just have to ignore how rough it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150243715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1473665938}
review:
TERRIBILE? NO...PEGGIO!:

In questa recensione non posso descrivervi piÃ¹ di tanto il gameplay, poichÃ¨ sul sistema da me testato il gioco girava davvero male.

OTTIMIZZAZIONE:
Una delle peggiori che io abbia mai visto, parliamo di circa 24FPS in 1440x900 a qualitÃ  minima (Very low) con una modesta GT730 con 2GB di GDDR3 e con tanto di OC a +300MHz di Core Clock e Memory Clock, accompagnata da 8GB di RAM DDR3 a 1600MHz ed un FX-8370e a 4.3GHz (Ok, Ã¨ vero che la scheda non Ã¨ gran che ma se pensiamo che GTA V su questa scheda va con FXAA attivo, 1440x900 e qualitÃ  grafica High-Very High + X2 MSAA sulle reflection a 32-43FPS, si puÃ² benissimo intuire il pessimo lavoro che c'Ã¨ dietro a questo videogame)
Beh, pessima ottimizzazione, ma buona grafica? NO! Grafica rudimentale, a mio parere si puÃ² paragonare al comparto grafico (ma forse ha qualcosa in meno) del Free-To-Play "Warface" (che a Grafica Media, Raggiunge la qualitÃ  ULTRA di questo titolo con un frame di tanto maggiore), 
Un qualcosa che mi ha fatto strocere ancor piÃ¹ il naso? La descrizione del gioco!:
"Built For Performance: With support for 4K resolution, 64bit-only systems and DX11, your hardware won't get bored easily." 
Cioe, non solo l'ottimizzazione fÃ  davvero pena, avete il coraggio di scrivere che c'Ã¨ un ottimizzazione perfetta e che l'hardware non verrÃ  messo facilmente in difficoltÃ ?

GAMEPLAY:
Il GAMEPLAY Ã¨ noioso e ripetitivo, semplicemente, null'altro d'aggiungere,e come se non bastasse ha parecchi BUG, il server crasha veramente spesso, sembra un gioco non finito ed inoltre ci vuole tanto, anzi, TROPPO tempo per respawnare!

PREZZO:
Non vale quei 0.99 centesimi, piuttosto sui dei siti web di key, trovate CAPOLAVORI come "A Story about my Uncle" a 0.83 centesimi!

IL VOTO?! 3/10

review:
Down To One is a game that I can't recommend because:
- it is boring
- it is terribly optimized
- it has issues
- the servers are crashing
- the respawn takes really too much
- it looks more like a unfinished game
- the only good reason to install this game is for the trading cards

author: {'steamid': '76561197999591258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1452300740}
review:
I go into a game and it becomes instant downgraded COD deathmatch. This game is complete ass not to mention 0 population. I mean it is 99 cents and I got for 29 cents. For the price of the game, you're not going to get much out of it. 
RATINGS
Graphics - 5/10
Outdated and poor

Gameplay - 3/10
Very frustrating and stupid to learn controls on how to pick up and throw weapons away
Awkward gun-play

Overall - 4/10
I would give 1/10 other than the fact is 1 dollar
The game feels like it is in devolpment and we are the testers. But we pay for it. It's like "Come test our new great software! We just finished the most basic parts of it! Pay a dollar to try some really crappy and useless software!"

I know what Early Access is, but the game feels like it is YEARS off of being a decent game. The devs in my opinion are great, they update and hold tournaments to encourage their game, but it doesn't make up for all of these cons I have talked about. 

Other games are almost identical and 100 times better like h1z1(19.99, 9.99 on sale USD) and CSGO(14.99, 7.49 on sale USD)

I would only buy if I was like a 10 year old kid who didn't get steam money and wanted a decent game to spend on that didn't cost that much money but was like a arena-survival game. 

IF ANYBODY LIKES THIS GAME OR IS A DEV OF THIS GAME, I KNOW YOUR GAME IS PROBABLY YOUR FIRST, BUT I AM JUST GIVING AN HONEST REVIEW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182203394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1460893571}

Started game up to 2 FPS. seriously this game needs major improvement. Went into settings, crashed game. Turned on my fps booster, got a steady 12 FPS. Get into a server, get a m4, and spawn on a guy who wrecks me.
This game sucks
Also support page is down for this game so i cant refund this garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126863979', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1463840865}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1684970377}
review:
Down To One is a military survival game where 42 players battle it to become the final person alive.

This game is a massive disappointment. I wanted to like this game a lot and without a doubt for a dollar this game is not bad, but it's plagued by so many problems I can't recommend it.

As stated before the game is a 42 player survival game where you go around a map and find supplies so you can become the final person alive.

The massive problem with this game is no one plays it. Now I only tried this game twice and once I waited an hour for a game and got nothing and then a second time I waited another hour and played a game which ended in 4 minutes. 

I had a fun time even though it lasted for that short, but the fact is I didn't want to wait another hour to play another game so it could end in 5 minutes.

The game also has a lot of glitches and bugs which could easily be ironed out by the devs. 

Texture popping, character models glitching, items clipping through items are just some of the issues that plague this game.

I really want to say more about this title, but sadly I can't say a lot. My honest suggestion is either find a community to play with or play with friends otherwise skip this title.

Final Rating:
3/10 - Don't Bother

If you liked this review please consider giving it a thumbs up and if you disliked post in the comments on what you disliked about this review.

For more reviews follow Snort's Review curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/snortsreviews#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

review: I like this game a lot. However it is pretty badly optimized. I have a crappy cpu but I am able to run games like CSGO and Payday 2 really well and this game seems to cap at 30 fps. It will even dip below 10 fps. Its a great game and a great concept. I feel if it were better optimized, a lot more people would play. And I bought this game for 59 cents so not so much money wasted considering I got a couple good hours out of the game.

Will change to yes when it has players and servers again. Yes the game is a potato but It cost less than Â£1

All you peoples need to do is click on show static servers, refresh list..

Perk system screen just outright freezes for me :S

author: {'steamid': '76561198050886763', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1454859097}
review:
If you want to read a first-hand description of this game, then read my review.

So first of all..
This game is ....

S_h.ii.et a.f! Graphics are not the best but it's okay. Bugs. Meh.
H_ard? No way. The aiming is kinda weird but its easy.
I_rritating a.f! I mean the corpses dance and groove like shit. No bugs at all!
T_echnically the Shittiest Solo Forever Alone Game of my life. 

But playing with friends is so fucking funny!
(rich bets + Skill Tree = YOU NEED TONS OF EXP AND MONEY....)

Having fun? The hell yeah. The bugs and the boring Battle Royal concept is suprisingly funny with friends!
Overall it was surprisingly good and the 1$ worth!!!!! 
(Even though at its release date they wanted 50bucks...)
+++++++++++++++
Kappa

author: {'steamid': '76561198086972142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1452644908}
review:
lol no. just no. If you're into entemology, then I would definitely buy this game. It has enough bugs to last you a lifetime trying to load the game menu. If you devote your life to the interesting studies of entemology and make it past the menu and into the actual game, then you should grab a pillow to sit on while you study even more bugs- some sort of wierd "que" system made it so even after an hour of weighting I still had not waited long enough to get my "turn" or something like that.

Scientists, welcome to indoor entemology, where you'll never have to step outside your door to find bugs again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064066770', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1422963594}
review:
[h1]Abandonware[/h1]

Bought 4x pack for 45$ when it was in early access. Then suddenly updates stopped to appear and, after like year or so without news, they pushed it out of alpha, together with dropping price to 1$ (3$ for said pack). Lesson learned, I think - [b]never trust early access open world survival multiplayer indies[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198035779677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1484581310}
review:
Can be difficult getting enough people to join but you get what you pay for. I'll admit I've only managed to play one game so far but I really like the concept of surviving, raiding and fighting other players at the same time (kind of like DayZ in that aspect). The game doesn't run completly smoothly so you will need to lower the graphics no matter what PC you have but even then it still runs fairly well and decent. For a mere dollar, it really is worth it.

For only a single developer, this is amazing work. Keep up with it

author: {'steamid': '76561198009103233', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1452723202}
review:
EPIC FANTASY REBORN 
The next chapter in the highly anticipated Elder Scrolls saga arrives from the makers of the 2006 and 2008 Games of the Year, Bethesda Game Studios. Skyrim reimagines and revolutionizes the open-world fantasy epic, bringing to life a complete virtual world open for you to explore any way you choose. 

LIVE ANOTHER LIFE, IN ANOTHER WORLD 
Play any type of character you can imagine, and do whatever you want; the legendary freedom of choice, storytelling, and adventure of The Elder Scrolls is realized like never before. 

ALL NEW GRAPHICS AND GAMEPLAY ENGINE 
Skyrimâ€™s new game engine brings to life a complete virtual world with rolling clouds, rugged mountains, bustling cities, lush fields, and ancient dungeons. 

YOU ARE WHAT YOU PLAY 
Choose from hundreds of weapons, spells, and abilities. The new character system allows you to play any way you want and define yourself through your actions. 

DRAGON RETURN 
Battle ancient dragons like youâ€™ve never seen. As Dragonborn, learn their secrets and harness their power for yourself.
10/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972279050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13213, 'last_played': 1663283076}
review:
It's a lot of die & retry but then you learn the map & where the good stuff is, then you learn how to use perks in a smart way, then you realize this is a game of patience & definitely not one where you can win a round by going around shooting everyone like Rambo. You will die.
I love the natural terrain cover, crouching behind a small dirt bank & moving along the hill lines is very satisfying. Everything else is pretty much standard battle royale with food management, but it's simple & fair.
Add me if you want someone to invite in a server to start a game

review:
I would award this game with game of the century. If that award was based on how much you wanted to go to the developers house and office and smack the S**T out of all of them. This is by far one of the worst games Iâ€™ve ever played by myself. I say by myself because get the 4 pack and playing with a group of friends, this game is amazing. The fact that it's so bad is what makes it so good. The bugs and glitches are great. Overall I think this game needs a lot of work but, in the end I think it's 

10/10

If you like the idea it's really not that much and you should try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083024504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1454819297}
review:
it took me only one game to realize that this game is not finished. when you need to have an optimization update after the game has been released then you know just how un-polished this game is. I had about 1-10 fps max while playing and the game had my mouse outside the screen. After the optimization update was released i tried to play again but found that there were no servers to play on that i could find (something that could be improved is the server browser) during the game i did play though with low fps, i did not find a single player in a full game and could not find out how to exchange my weapon or pick up any other supplies. i ended up winning this game and then never played it since. 

conlusion: this game is not that good so i bought the 4 pack

author: {'steamid': '76561198024648889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1454969053}
review:
Ok so my time on the game is 0.2 Hours on Record adn most people won't take my review seriously, but hear me out.

The reason my time is so low, is because the game is so buggy, that I spent my time trying to fix one problem for it to be replaced by another. So here's the full story.

I buy the game in the 4 Pack for me and some friends to have a laugh and play against each other. I download and install it, then I get a problem as soon as I load the game up. The mouse doesn't line up with the UI, well that's strange? So I try again in Windowed mode, problem solved. Crappy that I have to play Windowed, but ok I can deal with it. So I decide to change a few settings from the Default. I click an option that creates a drop down box, Oh? It's not working? I click again, this time the drop down menu appears, but the rest of the UI disappears! Now once I choose an option in the box, the WHOLE UI disappears. Now I can't do anything but close the application and start again. Great now the Menus here and the mouse isn't lining up again. So I repeat the steps, this time switching it to Fullscreen and it works. But now the Options won't change and the UI keeps disappearing.

So after trying numerous times to fix the issue and end up with the same results. I decided to Issue an apology to the 3 Friends I gifted this game too and sat myself in the naughty corner.

Do not buy this game, unless you're 100% sure it's going to work for you. I mean the price isn't bank braking, but I do feel rather bad for gifting this to people and having it stain there Libraries.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020093615', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1479448660}

[h1]Down To One[/h1]

So many people dislike this game saying the graphics are bad there are lots of bugs but you know what I say. 

Itâ€™s a Dollar People $0.99 I had a couple hours of enjoyment out of this more than a pack of gum or a snickers bar. 

Itâ€™s an E/A Game with current updates. I like its BR vibe and its dorky graphics reminds me of CS1.6/HL1 yes itâ€™s not as advanced as ARMA3 or Rust but hey itâ€™s fun. Try it out for yourselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159222211', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1539646251}
review:
I got this game because I wanted to kill other ppl in a battleroyal hunger games style enviroment.
Here's what happened:

-opens game
-joins server
-spawns in lobby and waits for for about ten literal minutes 
-soldier spawns in front of me with loud clicking noise
-leaves computer to go change pants
-after about 5 more minutes of awkward silence, 4 other guys join
- figures out you have to escape! to 'ready up'
-mysterious black magic breaks all the fences
-guys run out and I run with them, following at a distance
-after ten minutes of doing a yoga jogger run, finds canned pineapple!
-runs into same soldier that scared me with a gun in his hands
-two headshots later, I leave server and game crashes
As you can see, I kept playing. I love this game with all its faults. I even made a facebook page for it, cuz they didnt have one. just check out Down To One. It has tons of bugs, but the devs keep updating and fixing stuff, so it really is getting better!
10/10 would find canned pineapple again

author: {'steamid': '76561197966782422', 'num_games_owned': 1270, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1454273689}
review:
A slow start to development, but a fun game to jump on and kill 30 minutes. Especially at its new ridiculously low price tag.

Start scattered across a wasteland, unarmed and hungry with up to 41 other players. Then it's a mad Battle Royale-style rush for guns and supplies in a 'Last Man Standing' firefight to the death in a shrinking arena.

review:
This game is one of my currently favorite games. People Have been saying that this game is buggy that theres framerate caps and that its laggy those are ALL LIES, I have currently playing for 14.2 hours and havent really seen a bug other then the ragdoll physic and peeking thru walls both of witch are not a big deal. There are not alot of people playing sadly so sometimes it can be hard to play but most of the time theres enough people. Honestly the only kind of people i could see hating it are people like/with Integrated graphics and are just bad at the game or people who dont aperciate that this is a dollar game.


I JUST DO NOT SEE THE PROBLEM PLOX HELP?

As i see its deffaintly worth the dollar.

Personally this is one of the best games i ever played for a dollar and in my opinon its better then arma's battle royal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133027538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1453961155}
review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him. "if you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate. you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exacly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me - "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through". I agreed. At 25, i have never touched a cigarette. I must say. I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053882193', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1453920379}
review: Game is boring as all hell, nothing to do. You can't find anyone once you found the weapon so you just try to stay alive to kill that one person. The graphics are pretty rough too. Don't expect this game to be a clone of CS or anything. The good thing is that it's not too expensive so you can buy it even by accident and you won't notice. I've played many better games with better graphics, gameplay, music and pretty much everything for free. Imma give it a 3/10 cuz it's still in early development so it can get much better. It has the potential to do so. It just has to get more popular so there won't be 12 people on server but like 30 instead. That would be much more fun. Keep developing and you should get away with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058860989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1453503062}
review:
I do not have any words for this game so...
But i got a recipe for a chocolate cake:

The Best Chocolate Cake Recipe {Ever}

PRINT
PREP TIME
15 mins
COOK TIME
30 mins
TOTAL TIME
45 mins
 
Chocolate Cake with decadent chocolate frosting that will quickly become your favorite!
Author: Robyn Stone | Add a Pinch
Cuisine: Dessert
Serves: 12
INGREDIENTS
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 cups sugar
Â¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
2 teaspoons baking powder
1Â½ teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon espresso powder
1 cup milk
Â½ cup vegetable or canola oil
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup boiling water
Chocolate Buttercream Frosting Recipe
INSTRUCTIONS
Preheat oven to 350Âº F. Prepare two 9-inch cake pans by spraying with baking spray or buttering and lightly flouring.
For the cake:
Add flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, salt and espresso powder to a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer. Whisk through to combine or, using your paddle attachment, stir through flour mixture until combined well.
Add milk, vegetable oil, eggs, and vanilla to flour mixture and mix together on medium speed until well combined. Reduce speed and carefully add boiling water to the cake batter. Beat on high speed for about 1 minute to add air to the batter.
Distribute cake batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick or cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool for about 10 minutes, remove from the pan and cool completely.
Frost cake with Chocolate Buttercream Frosting.
NOTES
The cake batter will be very thin after adding the boiling water. This is correct and results in the most delicious and moist chocolate cake I've ever tasted! xo


Btw. IGN 10/10 PCgamer 72/0.2 Myself 0.0000000000000000000000000000000000001/10000

review: Horrible... Enough said. But i'm going to say something. I downloaded this game for a meager 1.2 gigabytes and fair enough for a survival game, however I can't even make it past the front page of the game considering it's tendancy to crash when you select one of the buttons on the main menu. If you enjoy watching a game crash on the opening menu then oh boy! You're in luck. My friend bought me this game so i didn't spend a dime, all i have to say is that I didn't get my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027522239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1509913405}
review:
Sure, this game may have some bugs, broken animations, bad movement, not a whole ton of optimisation and some Legacy Rust landscape. But I enjoy this game a whole ton.

You just have to be one of those people that can ignore how flawed a game can look and be and focus on the gameplay inside, and it's great!

It has a great battle royal gamemode which may have some flaws, but you need to work around them to have fun. It's worth the price, and with time who knows. Maybe this game will be much better.

It's a solid game to play with mates and kill some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043364962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1453327815}
review:
I will start this review by mentioning  that it is almost entirely inconsequential if you download this game or not. Maybe this game is worth 1 USD. 

Once you enter the game you will be greeted by an increadibly irritating sound effect that plays when scrolling-over or selecting something (great first impression). The next thing you will notice is the small  amount of servers and maps. In fact, there is only one map in this game, it includes 20 square miles of desert and 3 buildings. Good luck finding one of the 3 servers in america having the minimum amount of six players on it to start. if you do, you will run around  for 15 minutes looking at clunky animations and hilarious amounts of boring landscape. Spectator mode is one of the worst parts of this game. Not only will you be spending most of your time in it, but the glitchiness of it is incredible. Headache inducing animations and shaking. Like I said at the start, you can download and experience this game with almost no physical expense. But I believe it is an incredible waste of time. Just play TF2 ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971509396', 'num_games_owned': 3860, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1453158814}
review:
â€‹â€‹
Lanzado inicialmente en Enero de 2015 en acceso anticipado.

El concepto del juego nos sitÃºa en un "mundo abierto" en el cual tendremos que buscar recursos tan bÃ¡sicos como son agua, comida, botiquines y por su puesto armas y municiÃ³n pues todo ello serÃ¡ necesario para que podamos sobrevivir al resto de jugadores de la ronda (41 supuestamente). Como veis se puede resumir en lo que conocemos como batalla a muerte (o Battle Royal). Los trailers del juego lo venden bastante bien pues muestran un juego que parece ser solido desde el mismo comienzo de su lanzamiento en acceso anticipado. 

En esto momento es Enero de 2016 y el juego ha salido de acceso anticipado, sin embargo sigue estando prÃ¡cticamente igual que en sus comienzos. 

Si no tenemos en cuenta su calidad grÃ¡fica ni la de sus animaciones (ambas son bastante malas) y que no dispone de "mundo abierto" lo mÃ­nimo que podemos pedir en un juego "terminado" es que no tenga errores importantes que afecten a su jugabilidad...y en este aspecto estÃ¡ plagado de errores (grÃ¡ficos, fÃ­sicas, sistema de colisiones, netcode...) Por su puesto nunca vas a ver un servidor con 42 personas, si tienes suerte en el momento que lo pruebes podrÃ¡s encontrarte con un grupo de 10 y en un servidor de alto ping (mas de 150 generalmente)...

Down to One hubiera podido ser un juego de bastante Ã©xito si sus desarrollares hubieran trabajado algo mÃ¡s en Ã©l, pero se ha quedado en otro engaÃ±o mÃ¡s dentro del mundo de los accesos anticipados.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200740994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1460377802}
review:
BROKEN LANGUAGE ALERT! I'm not a native English speaker, but I'll try my best to make my thoughts clear and literate.

 Well, it seems that Down To One is being criticised for it's animation, optimisation, some bugs, that spoil gaming experience, and that is a problem. But still, this game has some interesting features and ideas, which, anyway, need to be polished and refined. 
For those, who don't know - Down To One is a game with a conceps similar to one in a japanese movie "Battle Royal", and it's the closest one to it. 42 men start a survival deathmatch with only one to be victorious.

Here are some things, that I think are good
+ Concept of matches is clear and easy to understand for a novice: you start at one location (or near a random one, if it is a server feature), get to any location to get some loot to start. Then, it's a weapon crate drop in a random location and playable area starts to decrease, making players move to a final location. Not speaking of survival part, which is obvious nowdays. And this is good.
+ Terrain of a map sometimes make sense. Snakes spawn near the rocks, waiting for players, There is a mine field, that is laid... well... tactically correct, if you ask me. Sometimes you can find water under trees in desert. But finding a pistol or an axe in a basket is a bit strange, but still rewarding.
+ Skill set is well-balanced, but not perfectly. You can't make an OP combination of perks however you try. But some game features make some skills not so effective (for example, "Play Dead" is irrelevant, as you get a message about a person died if he dies for real). This is easy to be fixed, and I hope developers know how to do it better.
+ There are enough weapons for a game released 11 days ago. I've not got tired of shooting this weapons as I haven't tried all of them. But I hope there will be more of it. And by the way, it's a pleasure for me to shoot with all this guns. I feel all the guns more realistic, than guns in Call Of Duty: Black Ops 3 *smiley face*.

I know, thet there are some bugs, problems with optimisation, animation and graphics, but I won't tell a thing about it as I'm OK with it and play on "Maximum FPS" settings. So it's not me to tell you about the graphics, but still it's not too bad.

The real problems are:
- Hit detection system is too random. It seems bearable if you shoot guns, but in melee you shall pray Tzeentch or any other god of Random to land a punch or get a target with an axe (especially snakes. If you meet it without a gun - you are 80% dead). The problem is that you can go through you enemy while fighting, and so can your fist/melee weapon, so hit will not be counted (I don't really know how to explain it). Just make player models solid, and it will be easier.
- Snakes. Snakes! SNAAAAAKES! Oh god I never thought that i will hate this creatures so much. They are way too dangerous here They bite as strong as a US soldier punch you in the face (according to logic of a game). And they decrease your hunger and thirst bars every time they bite. And they bite really frequent. And you think they are easy to be killed, huh? HELL NO! You will be 3\4 dead, thirsty and hungry when you will finally get it. And it seemed to me, that I spend as much bullets to kill a snake as to kill a player. Nerf them or make them easier to hit. GG FIX PEASE!
- Ladders. The thing is you don't reach the top of a ladder as you climb, so you have to jump to get to the roof. But that's a minor one. As some other minor ones I won't be wasting time here.
- Servers. There are too few of them and they restart after evey match. and it's a bit hard to hit 42 men on one server. Or maybe it's so because of my time zone. Make some less maximum players on servers and make more servers themselves. This will be great. Really.

To sum up... This game is good. Not great, but playable. something "7.1/10" if you ask me. Good for an indie. And of course, I recomend it to survival genre fans wwho are tired of zombies and all fans of "Battle Royal" concept. 
I hope developers from Gadget Games read this reviev. You do great now. Don't give this game up. You still can make it better and better and I look forward content patches in future. Good luck with Down To One. Do your best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066954812', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1459218879}
review: its a very, very good concept, and usually i dont reveiw games (if that gives you any sort of idea) The concept, as i mentioned is very.. very good, i enjoy it quite a lot honestly, but with it being so early access there are a lot of bugs as you would expect. the main issue i run into is framerate, even on the lowest settings i get a pretty decent amoutn of lag, and im running a gtx 650 as a graphics card, to give you a baseline, and dear god the night maps are BEAUTIFUL! but, again i experience even more lag on these (although thats to be expected) overall id grab the game now, but have a bit of patience if you decide to dive headfirst into the game, it will be an enjoyable expericne for the most part, but you must keep in mind its a early access when forming your opinion of the game! overall, wonderful game! just needs better optimization

author: {'steamid': '76561197999877977', 'num_games_owned': 1477, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1452935657}
review:
Refund button works.


Read the comment that this game was like H1Z1 BR......only it's not even slightly good.

1. Multiplayer is pretty dead
2. It controls like an old N64 shooter......not so much like a Goldeneye, as much as it is like the Southpark shooter.
3. The multiplayer really makes very little sense, it tries crossing survival mode in with the Battle Royale mode, and it just isn't fun.
4. Graphics are nothing to brag about
5. I guess for $0.99 you could potentially get some entertainment value from this game, I couldn't, but maybe if you and a few friends get drunk, and want to waste a few hours, then maybe.


 I can't see this game being played longterm by any person with the amount of shooters out there. I just feel like I have went back in time and played PO'd or some subpar PS1/N64 era shooter that I would pull out of the discount bin and say what the hell, it's cheap....and then instantly regret everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995215274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1452877001}
review:
How to start?

Down to one is literally the worst shooter I've played that actually runs.

The game they try to sell is a survival shoot your friends. The game they give you... well, it's more like CSGO minus all the things that make CSGO worthwhile.

The weapons feel flighty. The lack of indicators followed by your quickly dying means that most fights are horrifically one sided. The bleed mechanic, how rediculously fast you get hungry and thirsty.

There is literally nothing done well about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088776618', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1499082285}
review: Has much potential. the concept of the game is very fun and enjoyable especialy with friends but the glitchiness of the game like slight cliping problems are annoying but seem to be minor. the game is very well optimised and has pretty good netcode, i have bad internet but i am still able to play it with next to no connection issues and there is almost always a server with people to play with on. things that i think would make for a better game is better animations for the guns so they arent always in the way and things like a score board and a few other minor things but over all for the price and small download size it is a fun game to kill some time on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035625303', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 12302, 'last_played': 1712255647}
review:
I never had over 100+ hours for a 2 week time period on Steam or made 40+ $ from a game until I played this game

Reasons to spend ur next dollar on this game:
1. Fun and intense game-play that rewards precision shooting instead of spray and pray
2. Hilarious glitches worth 1$ even if you don't appreciate the game-play
3. Weekly Cups w/ 25 AUD$ for first every Friday at 8:30 AM NY time, so if you really don't like this game then at least you can win your money back :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198017329042', 'num_games_owned': 1912, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1452839026}
review:
+  Good concept
+ Perk system
+  Frequent updates, and devs are actually active in the forums, I give them that.

- Terribly optimized
- Technically horrible
- Laughable animations and clipping issues (with also LE FUNNI ragdoll physics)
- Random server crashes
- When you die you have to wait A LOT for the next round (and be lucky no one gets afk in a hidden place and people are about to kill each other to end the match).
- Very few servers (that most of the time are already in mid-game. Prepare to wait).

I encourage the devs to improve the game (even though that would be a lot of work) because it looks promising afterall. Just heavily unfinished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019265286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1452815836}
review:
When I say the bug report feature was broken, that should raise a red flag.

The redeeming features of this game have dropped Down To None. I'm certainly glad I only spent 50 cents on this game, because it isn't worth a penny more. 

This game is the result of removing everything fun about survival games and adding god awful controls. Prepare to spend fifteen minutes wandering a dark barren desert with default Unity sandstorm assets before you are killed in an instant by a player with a dial up connection who found a gun before you. Or perhaps you'd prefer to have your health drained by not being inside the play zone because it moves away from you literally faster than you can run towards it. 

You move approximately 30% of your run speed when walking backwards. Why it was designed that way I'll never know. I'm not even certain that any aethetic design went into this game. It has zero style.

Perhaps if this game got a complete overhaul it'd be worth playing, but for now save your money for a double cheeseburger at McDonalds. A message to the developers. Just quit working on the game and work on something new. This game has zero potential. I'm truly sorry for everyone involved, myself included.
