author: {'steamid': '76561198169724951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1465023769}
review:
Good game so far i have played i have put some pro's and con's together

Pro's
1. Good idea for a game
2. Super cheap
3. lots of slots for people to join
4. Fun to play with a friend
5. You can kick a soccer ball while u wait for the round to start :D

Con's :(
1. Werid animation bugs
2. Profomace issues. PS. could just be my pc
3. Needs more people to fill those empty slots.
4. needs more servers in diffrent regions
5. takes to long to join a server. i always join it to late then i have to spectate ;-;
6. player models dont really match the situation you are in. 

Overall thought

i do give this game a positive rating but it still needs alot of work. Give it a few weeks and it should be good to go.
mind you its only a $1 not much to expect. but overall 5/10 atm. get it now while its $0.50 

Good luck and see you in the arena :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198106658258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 3464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3464, 'last_played': 1452966279}
review:
EDITED: It is sad to  say that all i've said below turne out to be untrue, the game hasn't made any significant improvment, I thus turned this review into a negative one. NOT WORTH BUYING!


I can say without a doubt that this game has indeed a very bright future. Let me try to make this quick and clear for you guys :)

Okay, first off  I honeslty think that since I am one ofthe very few people whom have played this game for a long-ish period of time, I could write an honest review. 

As any other game of its gern, and the early stages of games, it is very buggy.. But with a great dev team who is working very hard on fixing the game, it is improving, and getting an update almost every week, which is more than what we need. The game has outstanding graphics, in my opinion. Also a very realistic survival atmosphere.

Let me just sum everything up, because I don't want to tackle every aspect of the game in detail and waste your time so the following main review is bascially look at the whole game and every aspect of it.

The game has lots of bugs, and that bascially ruins the neatness of the game, if it had no bugs at all, it would've been a complete 100% 10/10 survival game of its gern( I am taking into consideration every aspect you might think of, for example, the graphics, optimization, or even skill). But since the bugs are fading bit by bit, through the unwavering efforts of the Dev team, I suggest that you either wait a while until it is improved to its fullest ( which will happen in time) or you can support the devs in order to speed up the fixing of the game. The game haso nly one problem as I've mentioned multiple times, the bgus are the sole problem with the game, whether it may be in the game itself or in the server connection, whatever it is, it is the only problem with the game. Maybe the physics is a little off, more like way off, but they're working on it.

If any of the developlers are reading this, I'd like to just give you a peice of advise.

Your game is great, you just need to keep up the effort long enough, and fix them buggy bugs, in order to make it great, and when it is great and fixed, don't run off with the money. Also, DO NOT read any of the negative reviews, because that will only make you feel down and feel the loss of hope towards the game, so just hang in there, keep up the good work, and in three months tops,  I guarantee that this game will have great review %age.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201890381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1452735573}
review:
Yeeaaaahhh, this shouldn't be available to play, let alone even paying for it, even at 40% sale. 

Choose a server, wait for a ridiculous loading time, die seconds after spawning, get sent to spectating mode, see nothing but ugly looking static images of mountains used as the back ground and notice you're below the map, unable to see or do anything. 

So um, how about actualling finishing the game this time, guys?

author: {'steamid': '76561198111395290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1452731949}
review: First off, steam says that I have played 21 minutes of this game...WRONG! I spent 21 minutes attempting to play this game. Have not been able to actually get into any matches and when it does try to  load into one, screen goes black and takes me back to main screen, locks on a black screen, or the loading screen. I would be pissed if I payed more than 59 cents for this game. In my mind 10 cents would be to much to ask for this load of crap. Maybe fix all the bugs in the game before trying to lure people in with low prices. I would gladly pay upwards of 20 bucks if this game was even halfway decent, being that I love pvp fps games. Thanks for wasting my time, the developers of this game should be ashamed of themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256234722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1452726286}
review: Ill be honest, this is a bit... dissapointing. The trailer looks amazing, screenshots, everything looks absolutely amazing, however, when you go ingame... Yeah... The servers sometimes don't work, I get stuck in the Black thing (room or something), like, im in the void, cannot do anything, cannot click buttons, they wont do anything, sometimes when im spectating my game crashes, I couldn't even get to try the game, it always crashes, which is a bummer. However, it is 1 euro, so I can't complain, but still, the game is, broken, for now. I get it, its a new game, its still in dev, but still a no from me. Sorry. Fix it and maybe it will become a yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970864071', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1452720338}
review:
Don't buy this game. Don't even look at this game, just f*cking don't. It's not worth it, I don't care that its Â£0.50, I don't care that you want to buy it to laugh at it, because that's not what this game is.

A group of friends and I decided to buy it as a joke, we then spent 40 minutes looking for a server, suffering frequent crashes, and ultimately realising that it appears impossible to even host a private server between friends. Luckily the spectator mode worked, so we got to see the 'advanced netcode' in action, as players jittered around in a t-pose like action figures placed onto a speaker, occasionally flinging themselves into the sky, or getting stuck doing a satanic version of either a prayer to cthulu, or the YMCA song (your pick) .

To conclude: DON'T DO IT, RUN, JUST F*CKING RUN.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001661798', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1452661181}
review: Played 1 round of this game. This game isn't that great. It feels like a cheap h1z1. There were points where the game glitches and keeps you in place in houses. At one point I finally find someone only to trade kills and him to complain "I prefired you on your end" before I could even respond back there's no way he could see my end if there's no kill cam. He was up the stairs with an ak-47 in his face then standing on the base of the stairs before getting hit in the face with the final bullet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043179568', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1452557455}
review:
I tried, I really did. 
I'm going to be rude so please understand, here's a suggestion:
Go to any minecraft Hunger Games arena on those big 500 players+ server (More than this game's all time peak, I bet)
Copy their concept into the game.

The thing about this game is that it's so boring and there's nothing to do that it just make me want to play something else. If you can get teleported into a small Deathmatch after a *short* amount of time whether you like it or not, then the game will be more interesting and fast paced so other don't have to wait.

The other thing is optimization. Just horrid, I went onto a server and the models gets this annoying laggy look, then the corpses morth into some kind of monster which I WILL have nightmare tonight. Movement is like Fistful of Frags, only worst. In what case do I walk backward and sideways like a turtle, try and walk backward and sideways in real life, then apply that into your game.

World is nice, model is nice (except when they're turning into monster),
Animation: COMPLETELY BROKEN, your gun doesn't get put away so what you do is, you have a gun in your hand, while at the same time using the same hand, you grab a drink that gets overlapsed on the gun and chug it in. Why.

Graphics is a different issue, it is okay for me personally because I don't take it that serious, the models for the map looks like it was made out of a game from 2010. 

I played one match. And that was it, I waited 20 minutes for those 3 minutes only to get kill by guy with a shotgun and then I waited 10 more minutes and I said:"You know what. I'm going to spend money on Arma than to suffer in this game"

I recommended one of my friend in school. I regret every single word I said. "Oh well it's just 59 cents! How bad can it be! We should play together!" No. No. And No.

Please fix all or some or any issues described. Thanks. I'm looking forward for your future improvement. Don't take my word too harsh, just speaking out my thoughts. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198260605937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1452556221}
review: This game sucks. Dont let the pictures fool you, this game is not worth any money at all. I can run most games on high so this game was a breeze for my computer on ultra, but even then the graphics are horrible, same as the frames. I know I havent played long but it is near impossible for you to. As soon as you start the game a poorly made menu screen will pop up, you will have to position the mouse to the left of what you want to select.  After selecting play you will wait a couple minutes while all six of the servers pop up. If you manage to find one with more than ten people then you will spawn into a laggy, poorly designed map. People only punch eachother and you cant get away from spawn because there are cliffs surrounding the spawn that kill you if yopu try to leave, on some maps it is possible to not kill yourself, but unlikely. If the servers were ever populated it would be hell trying to fit 42 players inside a area the size of a small gym during the start. This game is not worth your time. It is laggy, glitchy, poorly designed, and no matter what rig you have you cant see shit thanks to the glorious 15-20 frames this game decides to gift upon our grateful asses.

review: Down To One has issues. The game is clunky, walking around feels like trying to move around a person made of stone, your hands cover the GUI ,and clipping is a very apparent and frequent issue. Still, considering how cheap it is, the game seems worth it. I wouldn't spend any more than the $0.59 that I speant, however. Many say the devs are active, which makes me think that this game will improve significantly over time. I would say pick it up while it's cheap, play it when it's good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058204854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1452544288}
review:
Put simply: It's a mess right now. And though I haven't played other games from the genre, I don't think it stands out much from others in its genre.

Positives:
+Extremely cheap to buy (59 cents at the time I bought it and am writing this)
+Perk System

Negatives:
- I'm pretty sure there's nothing here you haven't seen in another game of the genre
- Graphics aren't good (and are glitchy)
- Not optimized well, not at all (I have a 970 graphics card, but can't get anywhere near stable framerate past low settings. Even on low, it feels staggered)
- Glitchy as can be (Climbing a ladder will likely have you INSIDE the ladder, and you won't automatically get off the ladder until you're a few feet above it. There are a few other annoying glitches, but I'd rather keep this short)
- Less than good weapon spawns. You likely won't find a weapon until someone has already shot you with one they were lucky enough to find. I understand that they're supposed to be scarce, but it shouldn't take me 10 minutes just to find a little knife
-Gameplay is rough. I haven't been able to try out a gun yet, but the rest feels like one of the lower quality mods using the Half-Life engine

Quick little note: This is an EARLY early access game. It came out on early access 4 days ago, so my guess is that the dev merely wanted to rush something out so he can get funding for it.

Summary: It's a case of "the quality you'd expect for the price you paid" in its current state. I have no clue how much the devs are wanting to put into it, so who knows where it'll end up in the future.

review: The game is definitely pretty fun and only has a few bugs I've seen that i can easily get past and keep playing the game.  Graphics are eh but a game doesn't need triple A game graphics to be fun. A lot of people were bashing on the game for having to wait for a match to end but I havent seemed to have that probelm especially since there's 4 US servers and three EU servers that are have matches close to ending. Only con I have found is the the servers aren't really full at the time of day I've played at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073923595', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1452451645}
review: Horribly optimized, and the animations don't even work. When going to pickup items, your hand clips through the entire thing. It also happens when eating/drinking. If you have a weapon out and try to use a drink, you still hold the gun while the drink is in your hand. Spawning in the game is a mess; prepare to get beaten to death within the first 30 seconds. All in all, just save your money and buy Arma 3 or even H1Z1 for battle royale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022583487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1452450085}
review:
The game is buggy and very poor graphicly and animation wise, but is fun enough for 60 cents. Once you learn the basics of this kind of game like where good items spawn, how useless your fists are, and how to cheese the game with movement issues (crouching and jumping when climbing vertical boulders and moving through cluttered/low walkways.

This game is worth at most 1 dollar and even then that might be pushing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961016378', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1478005555}
review:
If you enjoy the Battle Royale style of H1 or other similar games, you should try this out.  It's very early, it doesn't have heavy funding or staffing on the team to get everything worked out right away, but it's a blast.  Even H1, who has plenty of money being thrown at it on a daily basis, has game crippling issues, so don't be so critical with this small timer.

Checkout http://www.twitch.tv/drizzintahl/v/34640202 for a recent stream highlight of the game. 

If you haven't played any BR style game like this, here's what to expect.
-Camping
-Waiting
-Patience
-Dieing quickly to something you didn't see or hear after 10-15 minutes of nothing happening.
-Getting punched out early before you get anywhere
-Getting teamed up on in a FFA

Don't expect a fast paced action shooter, this is about getting lucky with item spawns, supply drops, food and water spawns, and knowing the map.  Right now players will clip through walls, rubberband horribly, and meleeing people is very difficult because of the skipping around.

all that aside, I personally love BR gameplay and you can't complain about this price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037990414', 'num_games_owned': 1204, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1452473629}
review:
Game is a money grab.

1. Steam forums are official forum. Translation: We neither had the funding to hire a web developer, nor know how to create a discussion forum for our game so we're using Steam as a free one.
2. Has reached 1.0! Translation: This is the final product and full release. Included features are: General lack of physics, insane amount of bugs, completely broken animations, general lack of content.
3. There are virtually no servers. Transaltion: We will pull our servers in a matter of months leaving all players unable to play the game.
4. It cost 59 cents, and somehow didn't feel worth those 59 pennys.
5. In order to view the contact email it brings you to the Dev's youtube page.
6. When you declare a game to have "realistic bullet physics" it should have bullet drop and believable damage from guns. None of this seems to be in the game.
7. This game seems to attempt to piggyback off of Player Unknown's BattleRoyale mods for ArmA II, ArmA III, and H1Z1. The idea of a stand alone BR style game enthralled me. Then I launched it. It feels poorly done and incomplete.

In summation. This game feels like a poorly executed attempt to create a unique style of survival fps done by a dev who seems to have no knowledge of how a game like this should play or feel, and with no knowledge of how to properly set up a website for a game that presumably would be only successful if able to build a community, and it comes up short in all attempts and aspects. Were one, maybe two of the things I have listed true it might simply feel like an unoptimized poorly executed game. Sadly this is not the case.

If this game was not so broken it would be amazing. 

Here's how to play properly.

Step 1. DON'T BUY IT!
Step 2. Buy ArmA III
Step 3. Download Player Unknown's BattleRoyale
Step 4. Enjoy what this game was clearly trying to accomplish.

Maybe someday someone will make a standalone game of this type that doesn't suck. This is not that day, this is not that game, and whoever made this are not those people. I'd demand a refund, but honestly I could have used the 59 cents I paid for this on.... half a candy bar. So. No point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001961614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1452462783}
review:
If you ever want to feel like you've wasted money, this is the game to get.
I only spent $0.59 on it, yet I feel like it's not even worth that.  Hell with it, even if it was Free to Play, it would still feel wrong.
The overall quality of the game is abysmal.  The animations are terrible (I literally can do better) among other things.  There are several bugs and glitches despite it being a released game...
This makes the former WarZ look good...

-10/10, what has been seen, cannot be unseen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267291508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1466454287}
review:
Pros: It really has a lot of potential. Map would be great if the game were optimized better. 

Cons: Your computer's hardware does not change the fact that this game is a potato. The movements are extremely choppy at any resolution and character models along with everything else are still clearly a very early access game quality. Also dead bodies often start flailing and crawling around with their heads spinning so there's that too.

But yeah for 59 cents it might turn into something playable in the future so if ur bored get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025795328', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1480522582}
review:
Down To One est "une reprise de hunger games, Battle royale, etc."
Pour l'instant je mets un oui mais ce jeu est en tout point un jeu Ã  ne pas acheter et non fini comme ark. J'espÃ¨re que les dÃ©veloppeurs rÃ©gleront les gros problÃ¨mes (optimisation, hit box, ...), qu'ils feront comme les dÃ©veloppeurs dâ€™ark. Si tous les problÃ¨mes sont rÃ©solus alors ce jeu deviendra un jeu Ã  ne pas manquer.

 Je l'ai acheter a moins de 1 euro il en valait 15 Ã  sa sortie donc dans le pire des cas vous avez perdu 0.60 cts ce qui ne reprÃ©sente rien par rapport au joueur qui l'ont acheter 15euro ou les pigeons sur Cs: go :P . 

Si on a l'envie de rÃ©gler les problÃ¨mes que l'on peut rÃ©gler (jeu que en qwerty) et que l'on a le courage d'attendre que une partie ce finisse (7 serv au moment de l'Ã©val) et de jouer Ã  un jeu non opti (il faut Ãªtre con mais bon on l'es tous un peu ^^) ce jeu peut Ãªtre fun car le danger ne vient pas que des autre joueurs mais aussi des serpents, de la faim ou de la soif et l'on peut tout utiliser pour tuer les autres ennemis comme par exemple une pierre et l'on peut jouer au foot !!!
En conclusion c'est un jeu avec un grand potentiel au dÃ©veloppeur de faire le taff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043754318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1453326305}
review:
Okay lets start by saying I am a huge fan of survival games, it can really put skills to the test.

Now this game, it starts off with all the players in a sort of fort, obviously with the pure banter of just punching everyone (Damage is not dealt). The game starts by a few doors opening which means pretty much everyone is next to each other scavenging the few villages and buildings nearby, which is pretty.. well.. crap. Because of this, half the server dies within the first 5-10 minutes, axes swinging everywhere, it is complete chaos. I personally have reported the few bugs that I have come across (Fists covering the GUI, bodies ragdolling to the point where you cannot loot as their corpses are covering containers etc). 

Optimization, now this is key for a game, the spec requirements aren't that bad. Bear in mind that I have an R9 390x, with an I7. On Medium settings I am struggling to maintain 60..

Gameplay, it feels very, limited. Axes swing and you don't really get any feedback from when you actually hit someone, it's more of a groan then anything. Firearms are pretty overpowered, there doesn't seem to be any bullet spread? I can shoot someone from about 200 metres without aiming down sights aslong as their player is in the small squared crosshair.

Graphics, kind of ties in with optimization, it looks great, really does, but runs bad.

At this moment, I can only recommend because of the price tag. It is really cheap! I got this game for Â£0.47, you can actually (If you look hard enough) scavenge the inner city of london and practically find the change for it.

All in all, it is a promising looking game with a few bugs, that I hope the developer puts his foot down and fixes them up, as this could be a pretty decent indie title this year.

But for now, I will stick with Battle Royale on Arma 3, as this is a slight clone of it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198046208295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1452723109}
review: Down To One is a game where you and up to 41 other people loot and find food, drinks, and weapons to survive. The title of the game is what the very point of the game is, to be the one person remaining out of the 42 people. This game has a lot of potential and the reason why I am writing this review is to hopefully persuade you readers to buy this game and support the devs so that the game will get updated more often and be crafted into a masterpiece of a game. Also, for only $0.99 this game has pretty impressive graphics for the price, good textures, and pretty descent mechanics. Don't get me wrong though the game still has glitches and bugs but if we just be patient and wait the time that it takes for the game to be well updated, i'm sure the devs will give us a fun and quality product.

review: Didn't feel like posting a review until I saw all the negative. This game is fucking great. They've been saying that there are many game breaking bugs, however I have not noticed any. I only have one issue with this game, and that would be optimization. This game runs about as well as ArmA 2 did, Great for godly PC's, decent for good PC's, and shit for everyone else. With some optimization updates and more content this game could be one of the best Battle Royale games I've ever played.

Your armsâ€”mind you this is a first person gameâ€”cover most of your item UI and tutorial messages. There's no map even though the game tries to tell you to go to certain places on your map. AND to top it off the maps are HUGE and EMPTY. This wouldn't have been a good game 6 years ago.

review:
1â€¢ Start the game. > Game crash
2â€¢ Start it again and find a server. > Connected
3â€¢ Wait to spawn. > 15-20 minutes waiting time.
4â€¢ Before u can spawn the server will restart. > U will get disconnected.
5â€¢ Connect again , spawn and start get some good loot. > Game crash

Restart game and do all steps again.

1. 2. 3. 4. 5.

Kill some playes > Game crash

1.2. .....

Write that cool story and be happy with CounterStrike.
I want my money back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014606119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1452399679}
review:
I like the idea of surviving in a map and finding things to kill other players and having my own perk system, so the game can be KINDA fun... when you get to play it; otherwise it turns into a full-fledged Waiting Simulator 2016.

Pros:
- Good concept
- Perk system
- Frequent updates, and devs are actually active in the forums, I give them that.

Cons:
- Terribly optimized
- Technically horrible
- Laughable animations and clipping issues (with also LE FUNNI ragdoll physics)
- Random server crashes
- Uh... your character's hands cover the GUI Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯
- When you die you have to wait A LOT for the next round (and be lucky no one gets afk in a hidden place and people are about to kill each other to end the match).
- Very few servers (that most of the time are already in mid-game. Prepare to wait).
- Not really a con, but one thing to note. During Early Access, the game's price was 15 dollars, then it suddenly dropped to one (after the winter sale). The devs just wanted to increase the playerbase and that's fine, but I feel sorry for people who spent that much for it.
- e-Sports? Wow.

I encourage the devs to improve the game (even though that would be a lot of work) because it looks promising afterall. Just heavily unfinished.

review:
Spawned in. Climbed a mountain chasing another player and beat him to death. Went and found an AR and some spam. Spent the next few minutes looking for someone to kill on a 24 player map. Die of dehydration. 

Join a new server, die as soon as I spawn to what looks like fall damage. Join another server. Die to what looks like fall damage again. Try six more servers, same thing. Make my way to the review section of the store page and write this review. 

5/7 would get steam refund again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240939680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1480694851}
review:
Half of an hour of gameplay, can already give you a honest review.

I'm not going to slash the game down. It's in development. It's 59 cents when I bought it, so I'd say it's worth, if I wait it out until its fixed.

Pros: 
Nice Idea
Cheap
Good gun variation
Survival feel
No toxic people (except the people who say who bs it was that they died)
Devs still working on it
Weekly updates

Cons (Oh God):
Bugs. Thats it.
Poor optimization
You can glitch through walls
You can glitch though ladders
Buggy spectate
Animations not proper
The frames.. I get 15 on lowest settings and can play just cause 3 60 FPS on medium

Would I recommend?: yes. The Devs tr-.. I mean.. DEV tries hard to make his game good with weekly fixes. If you buy it now, and wait for the updates, one day, you'll have a battle royal modern warfare type game for $1. The price WILL go up if the game gets good. I would pick it up and try it a bit. people say its fun, if you're good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978866936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1452345081}
review:
I'm still not sure what had happened to me. For years I had simply been SWAT unit, tackling down the most dangerous criminals and hostile organisations to keep my city safe. Now, I had suddenly woken up in the middle east, along with a lot of other SWAT men.

We found little comfort in the small stone shack in which we were locked up and I could swear that some of my comrades had already succumbed to the madness of the desert. They began to hit one another. I kept my distance from them. A few moments later one of my comrades came walking towards me, hopping around in a manner which did not seem all that hostile.

FInally, the barricades keeping us locked in the stone ruins fell down and we all ascended down into the desert. The other officer which did not seem hostile was keen on following me but kept silent. 

We wandered the bare and empty desert and in the distance we saw one of our comrades get mauled down by a snake. This was truly a savage place. In the distance we noticed an abandoned village. We decided to scout it for food and water as we were growing thirsty and hungry. 

The loud buzzing of a drone filled our surroundings and we noticed a small device with red lights fly past us. Could someone be filming this entire process? Were we merely here for someone's amusement? A few moments later I had discovered a knife. I turned around and beheld my comrade's spine break as his body twisted forwards to grab a vase. He came towards me in a threatening manner. 

I had no choice but to cut him down. As his body fell down his neck extended and his limbs began to move in an inhuman manner. I fell down on my knees, madness had infested this place. I heard the footsteps of some of my other silent comrades behind me and I was punched down on the ground, the two silently beat me to death with their fists.

They were Down To One.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054745004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1452317193}
review: Saw the game for 59 cents, saw the mixed reviews and thought, how bad could it be for a couple of cents? Considering I haven't even played the game because every time I've tried to launch and play it, it has crashed. Very bad would be the answer. This game looked liked it would be fun to waste some time on but in all honesty I wouldn't recommend the download if it was a free game. After the third attempt at trying to get into a match I unistalled the game and got my 59 cents back as a refund because I will not support devs/games that are 100% unplayable. What's sad is that there are games in alpha/early access that run a ton better than this game and are actaully playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045967943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1452325743}
review:
Don't usually write reviews but when a game isn't even worth 60 cents i feel i have to. The game although it is version 1.0 has no optimization, the servers lag with only a few people on them. The game locks up and crashes randomly, and unless you use the join feature server option, chances of actually getting into a game are slim. If you join a game in progress and spectate till the next round a message pops up saying "round is over please join another server" and kicks you out.

I like the concept of a pure battle royal game but this game is not the one to deliver it. The servers are crap the player base is small and something as simple as aiming down your scope is broken and might crash the game. If your looking for a good battle royale style game look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992710474', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1452739797}
review:
I picked this game up for 0.59 which can't even be compared to mere peanuts,  for the most part it's fairly hard to get into a match simply due to the fact that there isn't any people playing.

The game itself is actually fairly fun, the ballistics are on point and it ran decently FPS wise, it's a typical indie unity game with a bunch of wonky and funny looking animations a lot of the time, but I am not one to get turned away by missing textures and bad animations, so long as the core gameplay is entertaining, which it is. 

The scenery is quite nice and the map is fairly big, there's quite a bit of diversity in the terrain and you have a large arsenal to come across as you scour the lands for weaponry, ammo, food, water and other nifty gadgets. 

Even if you can play this game for 1 hour at its current price and enjoy yourself, I'd say its worth it, heck who knows, maybe in the future it'll be amazing.
 
Given the extremely low price of the game and the actual fun I had when I finally got to play a match with a fair bit of players I give this a solid 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198065832529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1452385296}
review: So My friend and I were looking for a game to play. We stumbled apon this game and we found it interesting. We looked at the reviews and they were poor, but I gave the game a chance. I thought the reviews were just people's opinion saying how this game was shit. I was lagging really hard when I got into the game and when I was trying to refresh the game froze. After waiting for about 3 million lightyears the game finally refreshed the list of lobbies. All the games were in Progress but there were about 2 servers that were not in progress first. First server I tried to join it took me so long to wait while it was loading. In the end I never got into that server and I restarted the game. I tried to join the second server and then I finally got in after about 10 minutes. I was so happy to experience this awesome  game when I got in my character was shaking uncontrobally like I had a seizure. I started walking around and the graphics looked like McDonalds fucking potatoes everything was brown. I realized this game was not worth it after waiting so long to join one server . It took so fucking long that I was scared I couldn't refund this game for being in the game for more than 2 hours. Don't get this game and don't waste your time . My grandma is still in the loading screen after the last 70 years of her life trying to load the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109628660', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1488891288}
review:
I have high hopes for this game, it's nicely done and i cant wait to see updates.
Imagine CSGO with good detailed large maps, iron sights and more friendly people and guns that actually work.
The wild life was kind of a surprise to me thou.

It was alittle laggy, but my internet is bad and few people said it was just me. so eh.

I recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561197969827031', 'num_games_owned': 2720, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1452287064}
review:
Neat idea
Played one game of the "release" version oh the game and seriously got confused why it left early access, what they have right now is maybe what should be considered passable for a early access game, if they keep working on it and with the current price of 60 cents it might still be worth trying though?

It used to be $15, and thats insane

So going to recommend it just for the price to someone who's bored for 45 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021449293', 'num_games_owned': 1254, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1452277332}
review:
**I received a review copy of this game for free**

Honestly, one of the worst games I have ever played, and with 500+ games in my Steam Library alone, that's saying something.

Let's start with the gameplay. There is nothing special about this shooter. Run around, pick up weapons, shoot. It's that simple. Nothing that stands out, nothing that really shines. If I had to compare it to something, it would be like H1Z1: King of the Kill. Last man standing wins.

The graphics are also nothing to write home about. The screenshots may look fine, but the animations are broken and buggy. You will get caught in the texture meshes. You will fall through the map. 

Finally, let's talk connectivity. I've got a 75 down/ 12 up connection, but unless you live in Eastern Europe, there is zero chance you'll find a game with less than 100 ping. The lag issues are absolutely ridiculous, making this game unplayable.
Avoid at all costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217499484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1452272329}
review:
EDIT: What the hell is wrong with these devs all of the sudden? 1.0? Seriously? The game is not even close to be a so called "finished product". And on top of that they dropped the price from 15â‚¬ to 60 Cents? Thanks for pissing everyone off who bought the game a while ago and tried to support you. I once had quite some hopes for this game, but they are gone and so is my positive review for your "game". The only thing that satisfies me is the fact that this game will be dead within a week and you wasted a year of development on this.


This is my earlier review, just for you to see how wrong I was:
To write a review for Down to One is kinda tough. Why? Because so far I didn't enjoy it very much. The physics and player movement don't feel right, the border of the map is quite confusing at the beginning and the sound is pretty bad (just walk through a bush and you'll know what I mean). 

So why do I still recommend it? Because this game has the most dedicated devs I've ever seen in an Early Access Game. This game gets patched a couple of times A WEEK and it seems that they really try to fix bugs and other issues. I joined a steam group named "Let's play Down to One" and events seem to happen quite regulary, so even if there aren't that many players online you will get the chance to play with others. 

So I think this game is worth it to be supported and compared to the huge pile of Early Access bullshit that is out there these days, I can actually see this game evolving into sth. better and eventually into a finished product.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962072063', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1452266993}
review: No idea why this game left early access. It's a buggy sluggish mess. The sound sorta works, there's not much explanation to why you randomly die when joining a game. When you do join a game your weapons overlap your HUD, also the models of what items are in your hands can overlap. FPS is really low and everything feels jittery for no reason. It's a lot of nothing happens, then you get shot.

review:

+Can't complain about wait times (Seems to be some issue about having friends)
+Runs great on max settings on my PC (Radeon HD 7950, 8GB ram, AMD fx 8350)

-some camera bugs (can watch through walls)

Never had a gamebreaking bug

author: {'steamid': '76561198019388720', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1517586331}
review:
I saw this and thought "wow, that sounds interesting!", saw the price and clicked buy instantly cause I was looking for a fun FPS for the Steam Link.

Well.. lol I still like the idea of what this game should be. It isn't really much of anything right now though at all.

There are weapons floating all over the place, we got stuck in a loading room, random teleporting, random restarting..
I have no idea what's happening in this and from the looks of the people I was "playing" with neither does anyone else.. haha

I did like the gun sound effects, they are cool. That's it though. I wasn't a fan of the random color changing on screen at times or vanishing weapon models. lol

This thing really really needs major patches. I still like the idea of it and I think if some hard work was done it might be okay.. but damn does it ever need patches.

Also - There is an error when you try to exit a match where you get stuck trying to load the main menu and have to force the game closed with crtl alt delete. lol, classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980020293', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1455694157}
review:
I played for 32 minutes, here is my experience. I spent about 3 minutes fixing the resolution, took tweaking, but it happened. Then, fumbled for another few minutes with the perks menu; with five more on the server menu. Found out you have to right click to connect, couldn't connect to anything. 

Here's gameplay, soon after finding a server to play on. It was a slideshow from the lag, where I clicked ready, and eagerly awaited my turn. But that's just it, there are no time limits on rounds, so I had to wait. And wait. And wait some more. Twenty minutes of watching these people fumble through the lag with poorly optimized animations, sounds and textures. 

When it was down to two people, one of them died from thirst. It was time, I was ready. Loud music played, followed by... the main menu screen. It didn't start a new game and let me play, it returned me to the lobby. So, the previous paragraph IS THE GAMEPLAY, thus far. 

I am certain that you have to hit ESC and click "ready", where a mass of people gather in the "dead" lobby. I didn't miss a mechanic, it's like Counter-Strike. There are no respawns or drop-ins. You wait until a fresh game is there. 

The Good: 
-- 59 cents
-- Active devs
-- Cool name
-- Can run on a crappy machine
-- Decent concept

The Bad: 
-- LOL 

Overall, I am not refunding, I am going to wait a few patches and try again. My review is based on the current state, to a casual player, in early Januray 2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030697124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1423037158}
review: Bought in at $15 a while back because I saw potential in it during "early access". I've now come to check on it again to find it is out of "early access" and dropped down to $1 but still has all the issues early supporters spoke of at the time. Honestly, it's kind of a slap in the face to early supporters but it happens. However, I can't recommend it at all, not because I was shafted, but because it's literally unplayable still. Code is still buggy, waiting time for games is longer than actual gameplay time, hitboxes are bad, players literally "teleport" through objects. Honestly they should've done a price drop earlier or more bundles to promote the game because the early cost of $15 is a big buy-in considering you could get CS:GO for that price and an insanely active community.

review: A lot like games such as DayZ or RUST which arent really anything more then PvP games (try either one in single player both games are boring, most of the fun in both games comes from the danger of other players not the environment, the zombies in DayZ are more of an afterthough, I spend about 2 hours getting kitted up to die in roughly 20 minutes.) but without the bs, it cuts out a lot of the annoying stuff and forces a pace just fast enough to keep you interested and just slow enough to keep you on edge. author: {'steamid': '76561198037044572', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1700, 'last_played': 1536700416}
review:
In short: Good Battle Royale game, has some nice mechanics, but it should not have been released this early.

What happened here:

During the time the game was in early access, the development was exceptional. If you had any issue with the game, the developer would immediately help you out as he could. Any suggestion, criticism, etc, he was there to listen.

The updates were extremely frequent. At first, the focus was on content, from weapons and locations to gamemodes and mechanics, and more recently, the focus shifted towards the bugfixing.

What is perhaps the cause of one of the big problems with this game, is the fact that when in early access, the servers never got to fill up with the serverlist often being completely deserted (people who wanted to play, logged in and upon seeing 0 online players, they naturally closed the game instead of waiting on the lobby area for someone to show up). This situation basically hid many latency/performance problems that would only become apparent on the day of release.
It certainly wasn't for lack of trying though as the developer motivated it as much as he could by organizing and recording weekly tournaments. But still, people (like me) would only show up for the tournaments as that was a time where we were certain that we would be able to play the game (still, they rarely went above 15 players)

Game development is not easy at all. It is an extremely exausting line of work that as the added bonus of producing something potentially subjective to the worst types of criticism. I am not saying that no game is above criticism, but I can assure you that the best efforts were being made here. Whatever reason the developer had to release this game, I am sure that it was a least desired choice that had to be made.

But in the end, when people buy a game, they buy the final product, not the story behind it's conception.

Down to One has been an enjoyable and competent game, but it is extremely buggy, has some game-breaking glitches and (as many report) has some severe performance issues. As difficult as it must have been to keep this game going in early access, releasing it in this state will most likely hurt this game in about a month or two as the playerbase may very well go down again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983569531', 'num_games_owned': 2688, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1471352342}
review:
First off, this game is terrible and near unplayable. In the entire time I played this game, I never acually got to "play" it. After waiting more than 15 minutes while spectating at 10 fps, the game froze and crashed. I had a 17 ping and I have an I7 6-core, a GTX 960 and 16 gb's of DDR4 RAM. Nothing special but it should be more than enough to play this game. 

The gall of the dev releaseing this to 1.0 is huge. Dropping the price from $15 dollars to ~ 60 cents is also super insulting to the purchasers who paid $15 in early access. (Thankfully I got it in a bundle). 

When I had tried to play this game a few months ago, there was not one other person playing at ~21:00 PST. 

Avoid this game at all costs, even at 60 cents.

Anyway , don't waste your time ever

author: {'steamid': '76561198059439541', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1452644026}
review:
Is it a good game? Nope. Not right now at least.
Is it fun? When you can play, yes.

Why do I think itâ€™s fun? Because I didnâ€™t expect a perfect AAA title game. I knew this game had thousands of issues before I bought it unlike many of the people who wrote a negative review. 

To be honest this game arguably plays better than The Ark: Survival Evolved and Day Z in many ways. 
If the devs continue to work on this game it can be amazing. 

+Cool and original idea

+Art work (loading screens) is really nice

+Definitely worth 59cents

-Buggy but still playable

author: {'steamid': '76561198042203283', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1451748281}

author: {'steamid': '76561198099273116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1483908988}
review:
Terrible gameplay, just terrible. 

There are barely ever 5 server's on the list with even 1-4 people on it. That's after waiting 2 damn minutes for the servers to refresh. 

The movement is garbage. It feels like you stepped in fresh cement and never cleaned it off your boots. You move way better in crouch/prone <--- That's straight bullshit.

There are so many bugs, lots of screen tear and insane lag. 

The hunger and hydration system is slightly much. Up to half the players (pfft like 6 at the most) will perish due to dehydration or hunger... barely 5 mins into the match it seems. 

There is a floating dome that you have to stay inside of to avoid, I guess a gas. Like H1z1 that stupid sry ass game. When you can barely fkkn move or run as it is, it makes staying in this dome obtroucious. 

Whoever thinks $15 is a decent price for this game, is a fucking idiot. It's not even worth the $0.49 cents while on steam holiday sale.  IT'S OBVIOUS WHY THIS GAME GOES FROM $15 TO LESS THAN 50CENTS... IT'S GARBAGE. 

Don't let the current state of the game fool you, It's entirely possible for this game to be fixed and make a wonderfull hit, but atm.. WTF?

The guns are great though, have no problem with aiming, reloading, picking up items on the map. That's about all that works in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048300311', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1451664852}
review:
Pros:
+good price (got it for 0.50euros on a sale)
+cool idea for a game

Cons:
- poor physics ( you can get stuck in doors, walls, stones, pretty much everything..)
- sometimes weapon is not visible
- poor choice of colours ( 50 shades of yellow?!) - game looks much worst than in the steam screenshots
- not many people playing it ( saw 5 servers with 3 people last time i logged on)
- Release Date: 30 Jan, 2015 - 1year later still in such a poor state?? - not acceptable...


I would really give it a thumbs up, but i can't. 
It looks like a ripoff for a price of 13euros and a game that will never be finished.
Probably will go again on sale in 2016, so let's hope i was wrong and the devs from Gadget Games will prove me that they just had a busy 2015 and no time for real updates...

author: {'steamid': '76561198116218261', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1525952864}
review:
[h1] A Game with lot of Potential [/h1]

I bought this game for only 51 cents. I saw the trailer and thought: "Damn, this is some triple AAA graphics, I should give a try!" And what can I say? I'm impressed. Read my review por further analysis of this game.

Down To One is a survival game with a Battle Royal feeling. You start all together in one place and then you scatter around a huge map to find weapons, aid or food. After you all set up you try to eliminate the opponents. If you the only remaining, you win.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
The ideia is good, it's just not there yet. Lot of bugs but I guess that is normal in this phase of the game. But I played worse believe me. Compared to War Z (or Infestation: Survival Stories) this game kicks ass. There are still some major improvements to be done, polish some models and so on. There is a elo system (not sure why), perk system and some light customization. There is some things that made me exclamating: "Actually that is not a bad ideia". Two examples:
1- When you begin the game there must be a minimum of players so you wait in a courtyard. Some people were complaining about the time that needed to reach that minimum level so the dev made a football yard! When you waiting, you can win money scoring goals so you can unlock perks later!
2 - Cascavels that are posining and the PvE. Cascavels are a nice adition to the game and sometimes you enconter mines that blows you over.
There aren't many servers but they are decent. No EU server has it seems. As the game is a bit slow and if you die quickly, you can go right off to a deathmatch server which is very fast-paced and then go to a normal server again. 

[b]Map[/b]
Huge and pretty, again a lot to be polish. I hope there is going to be another maps in the future.

[b]Music[/b]
Wrost feature in this game. Sometimes is off sync and is not paired with the gameplay music. Weapons sound realistic though.

[b]Graphics[/b]
Not very optimized at least for my GTX 570. DirectX 11 is a nice adition and the graphics look beutiful. I haven't see any game with such clean and detailed graphics for this price. I recommend "potatoe" settings which helps you see your enemies from a far distance easily and it will make the job done. For some odd reason High settings are fine for my GTX 570 but medium settings i can't barely have 23 fps. So it still need improvements. Models are detailed and sharp.

[b]What I did not like[/b]
- Some clumsy player models
- Everytime that I fire a weapon my weapon starts to shoot to the oposite side
- Lack of players to play. Seriously dev, boost somehow the number of players even if that means to ask PewDiePie to review this game.
- You can see through walls
- More bugs
- Some server instability 

[b]Final Considerations[/b]
A game with lot of potencial. This game is patched almost every week or so I think is going to the right way. It needs a lot of support to be considered a "Finished game" and a lot of work is to be done. Support this cause by buying it and playing it. Also report EVERY bug you find. Dev would apreciate!

[b]Rating [/b]
6/10 

Peace!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073411359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1484093192}
review:
Good potential, just needs more people playing it. It's not the greatest game to ever exist, but it's not the worst either. I could really see it becoming a decent game if people would at least try it.

Consider it a very cheap version of Ark SOTF or H1Z1 battle royale. 

For 50 cents how could you really complain? I've played free games 10 times worse than this. The developers seem active and willing to continue even at the price it's going for, it's NOT abandoned; don't listen to the hate coming from people these days. Everyone just wants to get upvoted on their 'edgy' reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104814891', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1665184625}
review:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! Made a new review to make this visible to potential buyers!

Dev banned me for a comment I made 6 YEARS AGO on the forums 11 minutes after they posted the september 'update'.

What rule did I break? Apparently the "Multiple users reported your post" rule LOL. (I cannot find that rule in Steams Global policies.)

Screenshot. [url]https://imgur.com/a/qxNaySM[/url]
Updated video.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hectZEsYMBI

Clearly the developer is using their position to censor anyone who warns other users to stay clear. This was a preemptive ban, no doubt others speaking out got banned at the same time for stupid reasons also. Crappy update to milk more bucks out of suckers.

Don't fall for it. Games been dead since launch. It's as broken and abandoned as it has ever been. Avoid it like the plague on steam that it is.

And shame on you Valve/Steam for allowing developers to do this kind of stuff and sell scam products on your store and not removing them when flagged. Game is literally unplayable and nothing changed between early access and 'retail' aside from it having a 1.0 slapped on it.

Oh and to gogo-scammer. You should be embarrassed with yourself and your desire to still rip people off. Maybe you should have spent some money on the game instead of giving the money away in tournaments. You make Early Access and Indie devs look bad. LOL at you calling yourself a developer..... you're a joke buddy. Too bad you cannot censor reviews or my youtube videos hey?

Update this when my new video on the matter is uploaded.

----Original Review from 13 Dec, 2015 Below. --- Still Stands----- New video in the works to review these new 'updates' ----- oh your games gonna get some attention now go-go-scamget ----

Soccer simulator 2015, thought I was buying a survival deathmatch fps.

Decided to do a video review. Pretty much to sum up this game: I have owned this game for 7 months. Almost 6 hours of playtime now and that is just sitting in lobbies and walking around the same empty map and nothing else.

According to Steam Stats the last 2 weeks half a person played this game. When 15000+ own it.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FLEkUmmiHro

Good example of why Valve needs to rethink Greenlight and Early Access and review games themselves before they even consider letting them through to the next stage.

Early Access game is Early Access game is no excuse for these games being terrible. Blind fans need to stop using it as the one stop defense to explain everything away.

As one fanboy attempting to defend the game on its Steam forums told me. $20AUD you could buy a pizza. Take his advice, buy the Pizza.

This game unbelievably is actually worse and more broken than when I first purchased it.
A developer being friendly does not excuse a bad product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000324557', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1446801578}
review:
The real name of this game is "None to none"

if you could play this game drop a comment here.... no servers no players and no single player no tutorial NOTHING to atleast test the game for yourself. all the developers know is coming on forum supporting this game with "WORD" come online on NA time or i dunno US time 4PM etc and you MIGHT find players. so this game is basically made for a private group which is only online at the specific time?

I am not into graphics at all, i am playing since 1995, i still have my 1995 PC here next to me and its still working i still play all those MS DOS games despite of their visual quality. i did not have a proper internet until late 2005 to play online so that means i have played and finished almost every goddamn single player game which was released during those times. why am i mentioning this? i tell you:

Delta Force 1998 had a lot better and more realistic animations than this game which is 2015, it had more to offer than just a "main menu"

Wolfenstein 3D 1992 has a lot better body animations than this and guess what it even has "DOGS" and foods.

you might ask if i have not played then how do i know about animations? thanks to a guy who has posted a video review of this game in store page i watched 24 minutes gameplay of this game and it is extremely stupid. not even as EARLY ACCESS this should be possible, come on it is 2015 are you telling me your 3.5GB Eearly access is weaker than a 102MB Delta force 1998???

run the game for 6-7 hours and get its cards and sell on market 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982530266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1449583974}
review:
Fired it up, waited in the only server (empty) for 5 minutes or so. Nobody showed up; disconnected, uninstalled.

They discounted it to $1.75 recently to get people to play but that didn't work apparently. I'd love to have explored the game world at least, but you are locked in a room until 3 other people show up. It needs to be free to play, because nobody plays it now, and $15 for an empty unplayable game is ridiculous.

I'd refund but I think my $1.75 is better spent warning people not to buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084041088', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1456798568}
review: Okay, as a first impression, this game has alot of possibilities. But right now this game is broken! Now here we have thirts, hunger alongside health so you have to go and get reasources, sounds fun right? WRONG! This game is on sale right now for less then $2. And it shows it. Bugs everywhere, you grab air, you teleport into the freakin sky and even clip through walls. Now it's up to 42 players but your lucky if you find five! Also freakin lag aswell, you thought Call of Duty lag was bad... this make that look like the best connection ever! Also in this wasteland there is no such thing as reasources! Only some sports drinks like two waters and some bags of mre's. Weapons are done well enough but the hit detection for them is nothing because of the lag, you can take an ak and because of lag unload a whole clip and it won't kill them. Now after playing this in bursts of a few minutes the game crashes and messes my pc up. What the hell is going on here?! Please someone help me out here. Are the devs drunk? Will this work eventually? Oh and the menus do not work, either they work with the cursor on them or you aim your mouse like a musket and hope it works. Now the premise is good don't get me wrong but the devs need to fix this game and fast, maybe make the map have more reasources, more maps and maybe make the maps smaller. I know this is early access, but this game reminds me of the glitchy mess of Fallout New Vegas when it first came out mixed with the glitches of Mindjack and connection issues of Arkham Origins with a dash of the looks of Alpha Protocol and here you go. Please fix this game, I want to enjoy it but I can't in this state, hurry devs, please don't waste this games potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968393468', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1669972543}
review:
Overall a good game. A bit buggy at times, but that is to be expected for something in early access. Developed by a developer that actually listens to the community. Speaking of the community, it is a bit small right now, but, I am hoping that it will grow.

A very good and constantly improving entry in the Battle Royale/Survival genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113140223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1443890467}
review:
Currently, the game is just not good. My review is based off of playing practice mode, as there are no servers with more than 0 or 1 player.

Pros:
-Solid concept
-Game could have potential
-Bad animations provide a chuckle
-Player can look down and see silly little feet

Cons:
-Nobody plays the game
-Collision detection is abysmal
-Bland assets
-Controls can be janky
-Climbing ladders is hilariously bad

Conclusion:
Game may be decent some day, but right now it is nowhere close.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996310759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2034, 'last_played': 1466773773}
review: Down To One is a fun game that is patched weekly and it, just as every other early access game, has some bugs here and there, but nothing game breaking.  The game's concept of PvP survival with random loot across the map is pretty good and big, open spaces play greatly with realistic bullet physics. The only thing the game is lacking at the moment is big playerbase and in order to get a match to play you have to join the DTO group (https://steamcommunity.com/groups/lpdto). It is worth noting that there is a  tournament hosted every week on fridays, with both veterans and new faces playing regularly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044361756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1489121523}
review:
Alright First real review from me. 

Down To One; Simply put would be brutal no rules deathmatch. 42 players in a game, only one winner. 
It almost has the feel of hunger games style play (instead of middle loot, there is a air drop) mixed with a bit of survival aspect combined with a FPS. 

Eat, Drink, and survive your way to the #1 spot anyways you can from gunning down, to chopping up, stabbing, to throwing a rock at the enemy. Anyway to survive, but beware of your hunger and thirst as well as the poison filled snakes.

Cons: 
- Not well known, so hard to find a game to get it started. There are groups so people are informed. 
- Its EA, there will and is bugs. 
- People dont like to wait to gather more people to start.

Pros:
- The current community is really nice, and will usually answer questions.
- The map in the current state has quiet a large radius with a few different major areas, with a mix of smaller areas. 
- There are updates all the time
- The dev(s) listen and constantly balance and update, as well as create tournament. 

in the end, regardless of the current state I would recommend this game to others, we need to get this game known so people can enjoy it. Lets make the community grow :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197968560421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1429705884}
review:
DOWN TO NONE. This game is already dead. You will never find a single person playing this game. Out of the dozen or so times i've opened this game to see if any servers were running there was ONE time where i found a server with 6 people playing (and one or two guys were the developers)

And once the game ends (once all players die) the server just shuts down and needs to be restarted so you have to manually refresh the server list hoping all the players will re-join that same server again for another round.

Then you have to wait for 3 players to join and ready up (the chances of finding 3 other people playing this game at the same time is super rare)

Even if there are people playing, the time in-game compared to time-waiting to play is like 95% waiting to 5% gaming.

Not only that but its just a very mediocre quality fps

review:
Excellent and active community of people experiencing the Battle Royale type experience (still in development) with not too many bugs left to iron out and a great development studio willing to play the game themselves every day with the fans and hear out feedback in full as well as release tons of patches.

I'm addicted to this game. Follow them on Twitter if you buy it to be up to date with some of the more plentiful matches: https://twitter.com/downtoonegame and the Steam Group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/lpdto which will give you Event Notifications every time a major match is going on.

(you can also find matches other times than this but for those having trouble here you go)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055610632', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1452978715}
review:
EDIT: Now since the game is fully released, I can with a clear mind say, that I don't recommend this "game" to anyone. It still has performance issues although they are not as bad as previously, but still. If this game tries to be competitive (Esports) then there is no room for such performance issues as these. The game is still hardly playable, the Ragdolls are still a joke, the same goes for animations. The game still looks like an early alpha of a game that shouldn't exist in the first place. And I feel sorry for those, who actualy payed more then 15â‚¬/$ for this game. I expected the game to be a mess and that the game will never reach it's playable state and I was proven right.




Well where do I even beginn with this review here?

I think I start of with what the game is suppose to be, what it has and what the game actually is.

The game is suppose to be a Last-Man-Standing shooter with survival aspects such as hunger, thirst and snakes.
Depending on the server (whether random spawns are enabled or not) everyone is starting at the same spot in a "Waiting area" in which you play soccer while waiting for people to join, yes I say "join" because you mostly wont come as far as that. How ever, when the game starts you are suppose to scavenge for food and weapons to survive against other people in an open desert area. The area gets smaller after time so you don't have to search for other players. And, like I said earlier, it's last man standing, so the goal is to be the last survivor, Down to One.
You can also choose different perks and unlock new ones by leveling and "grinding" money, which you'll get for playing. You can choose up to 3 perks to carry at the same time and you can choose your "camoflage".

The concept may sound very simple, right? Well the execution of it is barely excuseable. Why? Because it's unplayable in it's current state in every possible way. I know, it's early access and that in such a form, bugs are inevetible. But you should at least expect the product to work in it's core state. Thing's such as getting into buldings, netcode, getting items (sometimes they float in unreachable places) and so on should work properly, which they doesn't. The awfull animations are bareable since they are only a visible aspect about the game and which SHOULD'T work perfectly in early access, that's okay. But if the core gameplay is not working, then it's only okay if:

1st it is stated as "Closed Alpha" for experienced people, which should be able to fix the game as soon as they discover an issue.

2nd if you don't charge money for that untill the game is ready and only needs balancing tweekings. Then it should be early access ready and only then you can charge money for your product.

3rd if the developer himself can't find gamebreaking bugs which need to be fixed, then you can release your product as a public testing version to find new bugs and to fix them.

That is the purpose of testing and supporting. That's what early access should actualy be about. It's not something to use an excuse for a game which is broken right from the start and still charge money for that.

The performance is also very poor. For me, the game freezes every few seconds for a minute or so. My PC may not be the best, but I can still run games which require more ressources for instance: Call of Duty: Ghosts (Which is terrible) is still running more playable on lowest graphic settings then this game (which are also on the lowest settings set).
I also know of people, who have a much better PC then I do and can run most games on highest settings, it still runs very poorly on the lowest for them and for me, when the game "runs" atleast in the waiting area and if i look on the ground the game runs playable. I think the reason for that is the unneccecary big map, which you cannot enter completly since the game will make the playable area smaller after time. Alternatively you could just make a more closed space like a building or something so your PC doesn't have to render unnececcary "Crap" which isn't even worth looking at (Endless desert with nothing to see and without being able to access it)

But the most thing, which I'm wondering about is, that' although it's "Mostly Positive", almost no one is playing the game. It takes way to much time to wait for players to join in and start a game and I ask myself "Where are the people who actually like the game". If I like a game, then I play it activelly for some time of course and this way, atleast 1 server should actually be constantly full. But it isn't and even people who recommend the game are just ignoring the game.
I think it's because people recommend the game because it COULD be playable and good and that the developer is putting "effort" in it, which is the stupidest thing you can do in my eyes. Do you think a teacher gives you a good mark for your exam before you even write it because it COULD be good or, if everything you wrote is wrong and terribly readable although you put "effort" in it? I think not.
The only thing to expect from the developer now is that he fixes the bugs as soon as possible and that he should look for help to increase the chance to fix the listed bugs as soon as possible. Otherwise, the game will eventually die because no one is playing it and because of that, the developer will loose interest in his game (I think it's only 1 guy).
Otherwise: Do Not Buy the game in it's current state because it is unclear, if the game will be playable or not but most things tell that it will not.

If you ask yourself, why I have the game? Well, I bought it in a bundle with various other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069490363', 'num_games_owned': 2600, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1495020708}
review:
--->WARNING<---
This is not my final review, this is just an early access first impressions. Final Review will be set once the game is fully developed

As of yet, I have failed to join any servers because there are no servers in Australia. Closest Servers I have joined are in South-East Asia and they are only filled with 1 or 2 people which are not enough to even start the round. author: {'steamid': '76561197967220570', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1428183069}
review:
I wanted to like this game. The idea of an extended survival deathmatch has been on my mind since Battle Royale/Hunger Games. I bought 'Down To One' over a month ago, and to this day the servers are still empty. All hours of the day (morning, afternoon, evening, past midnight!), the servers have either 1 or 0/42 players. I haven't yet been able to play the game so I can't pass judgement on the multiplayer. But from what I experienced in the practice server (only 1 person required to start): the audio sounds are weak and low-quality,  the environment looks like it was clumsily thrown together with cheap Unity assets and thoughtless lighting, the collision is terrible (floating pickups everywhere, can't reliably climb ladders), the theme/worldbuilding/writing is non-existent (there's no explanation at all for why a bunch of militants have gathered in the middle of a desert to shoot modern-day firearms at each other).

I did enjoy the nifty IK animation they put in when you pick up an item (your character's hand extend towards the item). I also liked the way they handled the UI for items (you press a # key to select an item in your inventory, then press keys to either drop it or use it).

The survival game idea is definitely cool, and definitely a trending genre in PC games right now, but the execution is TERRIBLE. 'Down To One' in its current iteration isn't even playable. I don't know what the future is like for these guys, but best of luck to you. Hope you finish your project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212086984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1434335644}
review: For right now I can't give this game the thumbs up. On the plus side the developer has been releasing updates to the game on a regular basis, but has made no attempt to change the game mechanics which are really really stiff.  The other issue I am having is I have yet to play a single match in this game. Every time I login to the game and join a server there is literally no one in there with me. Not once have I come across another player and I have made myself ready when in the match. The concept for the game is really a cool idea but the game is not executed very well at least not yet. I do understand that this game is in Alpha and will change my review accordingly if further development and changes are made. I really want to like this game and am happy that I bought it on sale. I really do not believe in its current stage that this game is worth the full price to play. Again over time my opinions my change but for right now I have to give it the thumbs down.

review:
Gioco in accesso anticipato quindi ancora acerbo, ma molto seguito dal suo programmatore, che Ã¨ molto attivo, sta dientro al gioco sistemando molto velocemente tutto ciÃ² che non vÃ . tra l'altro crea eventi, partite in cui lui stesso gioca, ed Ã¨ anche forte ;)
il gioco sostanzialmente Ã¨ costituito da un gameplay battle royal, un tutti contro tutti, in cui ne dovrÃ  rimanere solo uno, perÃ² con un tocco di survival, in cui non dovremo controllare solo la barra della vita, ma anche quella della fame e della sete. partiremo senza nessun equip, saremo cosÃ¬ costretti a girare nella mappa in cerca di qualunque cosa possa aiutarci a sopravvivere ed eliminare gli altri giocatori; una mappa che piano piano si restringerÃ  costringendoci a doversi affrontare prima o poi, e limitando anche il tempo delle partite. 
Un gioco che per ora forse puÃ² essere considerato un investimento per il futuro, anche se giÃ  da ora si lascia giocare bene. ancora poco popolato, e con difficoltÃ  di far partire un match tranne quando vengono fatti eventi a cui, come detto prima, partecipa il programmatore. 
comunque un buon gioco che mi sento di consigliare!
