author: {'steamid': '76561198068308005', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1425851274}
review:
A primo impatto il gioco ha un concept veramente interessante. Una sorta di Hunger Games con armi attuali.
Il gioco (prima che lo offendiate) Ã¨ stato realizzato da UNA sola persona. Essendo in accesso anticipato Ã¨ normale che ci siano diversi bug (ma parlando con lo sviluppatore gli risolve non appena glielo fate notare).

Questo gioco credo che una volta raggiunta una certa stabilitÃ , diventerÃ  un KILLER GAME, le partite non durano mai troppo dato che nella mappa vi Ã¨ una sorta di cupola trasparente che si restringe frequentemente, la mappa per ora Ã¨ una sola, ma credo che se si mantiene lo stile di semi-desolazione si riesce a mantenere quel senso di sopravvivenza che non avevo mai provato. 

Bisogna tenere conto della fame, della sete e della propria salute, di trovare le munizioni sparse per la mappa e di stare attenti ai nemici. Partite fino a 42 giocatori, i server non laggano e sono disponibili sia USA che EU. 

Ripeto ad oggi che scrivo questa recensione mi trovo a dire che Ã¨ un gioco con un potenziale assurdo, tanto di cappello per lo sviluppatore che se riesce a risolvere vari bug e ad inserire piÃ¹ mappe rende questo gioco uno (a parer mio) da finire dritto per dritto nelle classifiche dei "PiÃ¹ venduti"

[b]Pro[/b]
[list]
    [*]Gameplay Originale
    [*]Senso di sopravvivenza a causa della desolazione della mappa
    [*]Partite ben equilibrate grazie al restringimento della mappa
[/list]

[b]Contro[/b]
[list]
    [*]Parecchi bug (da risolvere)
    [*]Animazioni dei giocatori bruttine (da risolvere)
[/list]


Voto attuale (considerando la fiducia del risolvere i bug) 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198125088003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1425080521}
review:
At the current state of the game, I WOULD highly recommend... But beware, the game is quite dead. In the 4 hours I've played, I played 4 matches.

The matches I DID play were fun, though. There is a very tense atmosphere, as the playing field gets smaller and smaller, and you know there's people who want you dead. Not only do THEY want you did, but there's currently snakes that do too, along with hunger and thirst. The game has somewhat poor performance, but I'm sure that's because my computer isn't exactly the best (High end 2009 laptop). It is also a a bit buggy. My first round was spent under the map, as I fell through it in the waiting area. I've also taken fall damage from stepping off a ladder, though I think that glitch has been fixed.
Overall, once you get INTO a game, I'd give it an 8/10.

tl'dr play it if you're prepared to wait a while for a match.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118568851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1423707206}
review:
Don't let my played hours fool you.  While this game is in early development it is backed by the kind of game developers that you really want to support and I've done so by putting my money where my mouth is.  I've purchased a total of 7 copies of this game giving 6 to friends and obviously keeping one for myself.

Let's start with the concept which is really fun that you start out in a building with a clear view of the heavens above and the 4 walls around you with the other players on the map.  As the game starts you all disperse through the exits (the game developers recently added more exits) and are now on a mission to find weapons (firearms and melee) as well as food and water because the longer you're out there trying to survive the more the game will require these things.

Outside of other players you will have to deal with snakes and some other unforseen obstacles.  The game developers are constantly working to keep us on our toes with more additions and fixes to the game and have been rigorously commited to putting out a solid patch every 2 days which is next to unheard of with early development games.

The only real downside to the game right now is the limited player base, but they are actively working to expand upon that and I highly recommend getting involved with this game.  It has a tremendous upside and a great development team behind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115676429', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1455877731}
review:
Here it is:
Spent 10 mins choosing a camo
Spend 10 mins figuring out you had to click 'Refresh' to find a server
Joined
Waited 30 mins for others to join
Listened to music
Forgot I was in a game
Rejoined
Played football for 20 mins in-game
Ran to a tower, found a weapon
Suddenly I'm one of the only two players left
Sneaks up on the other guy and shanks a bitch
11/10   Like Hunger Games with Guns
dont buy

author: {'steamid': '76561198090460161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1422841825}
review:
~As of Early Access~

Developers patch and add content at a rate that's truly remarkable. It's a good game that deserves a little more recognition that it's recieved so far and while, yes, it had a rocky start... it's shaping up into something wonderful. The Devs are quite transparent and quite interactive with the community. It just needs a bigger community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066196927', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1491797129}
review:
=WARNING= Game is very early alpha!
          The game needs some love, its very well set up. It just needs some people. I think if the price was lowerd, this would bring more people in. Yes the Animations are bad, but there funny, so it makes up for it, and in time they will be changed. Its called a Early Access Game for a reason. The game has so much potential and I think people need to see that. Give it a try if you don't like it comeback when the game is more finished.

Hes some funny moments I had ingame!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9NZPcCec0Ww

Edit: This game has updated multiple times in a row (days) Keep it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990741081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1424382093}
review:
I've never seen a game update so fucking much in my entire life, i swear every time i open steam its doing a new down to one update, if you're wanting to throw money away do it at these developers because once the game is in a really nice state im more than sure the second the community says "we need a new map" they will have their entire team working on it,  its kinda rough right now because people mainly log in later on in the day to play, its pretty dead if you play on the off hours, like a lot of games now tho.

The game itself is pretty cool the only complaint i have once you get in game and situated is that theres not many places to go in the dumb desert map they have right now to get loot, its just a few towns really

author: {'steamid': '76561198001833208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3545, 'last_played': 1599934862}
review:
I hate Open World Survival games.
I hate any Early Access game. The whole idea of Early Access and Pre-Orders just make me want to nuke America.
BUT THIS GAME IS FANTASTIC.
I LOVE that I got it in early access, be it a survival game even.
This game is recieving updates faster than Team Fortress 2. And that says a hell of a lot.
Watching this game grow literally everyday is almost as fun as the gameplay itself.

Buy this game or stay an unhappy scrub - That's my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067386739', 'num_games_owned': 1977, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1445662106}
review:
EDIT: The game has been released. They also dropped the price under the pretense of getting more people into the game. Even though they have given free keys almost every day and mass giveaways when they came to early access and still no one played it.  It is still unoptimized , the animations are still bad (they told initial supporters they where placeholders) and the game still crashes randomly.  If you are considering buying this game at its current price. PLEASE DON'T. 

All you are doing is supporting developer's that cash grab with unity free assets by cobbling up "games" together for fast cash. The game has BARELY changed in a year and it is still a broken unplayable mess. The developers lied to all supporters saying these issues would be fixed before launch. They never got fixed. Their servers are so bad and the optimization is so bad that they can't even handle the load and crash. Same problem since day 1.  PLEASE DON'T SUPPORT THIS BEHAVIOUR. All you are doing is providing cash grab devs with income. They could care less about you or the game as its READILY apparent to anyone , especially those who purchased on day 1 and listened to their lies.


Tried enjoying this game but between the horrible animations , glitchy terrain , slanted buildings , wrong-sized doors and pretty much being completely opposite from what Battle Royale should be like (Everyone spawns and runs out from the same place instead of randomly on the map).

Aside from ALL that I still tried to enjoy the game. Until a 16yr old forum mod for this game decided to harass me for asking him about the connection issues the game was experiencing. Instead of removing the troll mod , he actually decides to ban me and not just lock the threads but delete every single thread or post I was ever in.

He bans me under the pretense of removing me for toxicity yet leaves the 2 other trolls who where insulting me through the whole thread. They are still not banned to this day. Nor is his mod either.

Its bad enough the game is a broken mess. Early access or not this is barely even an idea. And 99% of the time is unplayable. Servers don't connect or no one is playing. But then you gotta deal with little kids as mods and devs that defend them...

So if you wanna know whether or not to get this game or even play it for free. The answer is clearly no. Its already as its name implies.

http://steamcharts.com/app/334040  2 playing 51all time peak

Also , those positive reviews seem to come from the mods and their friends. Most if not all received their keys for free. The dev continues giving out keys on twitter as well to try to infuse players into the game. Even with FREE keys the game remains dead. Not even enough people to fire up a match.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971667079', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1451856814}
review: D.O.A.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003200316', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1452367642}
review:
An emotional rollercoaster in glitches, bugs, bad animations and clunky gameplay. 
But is probably the greatest game to have ever existed. This game focuses on interactions with other characters, developing loves and hates, enemies and friends along the way. 

Unlike Dayz, you don't spend hours to do something just to die and lose everything, everybody got half hour to survive and then start back from the begin with nothing, so no time wasted. 

I recommend this game, if it gets fixed and polished properly, it would have a great potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065102328', 'num_games_owned': 985, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1425161008}
review:
The wait time to get in a game is pretty annoying at the moment, and the player animations are really.... funky. Other than that, the concept and the gameplay itself is actually really good and fun. Players spawn in and spread out scavenging buildings and watch-towers for weapons and food and water. Yes you must feed and water yourself to stay alive as well as watch out for the other players. Once you're out... you're out and the game continues to last man standing. I found it pretty hard to find a ranged weapon at first until I came across a small military base. I picked up a gun very similar to an awp from CS and began lurking in the tops of the mountains killing other players. My first game lasted about 30 min but it wasn't slow paced at all. We had a total of 20 something people in the game and at the begining, people seem to die fast from not watching their backs and getting melee'd in the back. I would say that probably 10 min in we had less than what we started with. Now once it came down to me and the last guy, it became quite boring. I'm not sure if he was just camping or we were walking circles around eachother but it took quite a while before i finally snuck up on him and picked him off with a headshot from behind. All in all it was quite fun and I played a few more games. There definitley needs to be some updates and changes especially to the player animations and the scopes on weapons. There are updates being made and the Devs seem to be answering most the questions in the forums and taking suggestions. We all love to see that with Early Access Games. I definitley recommend trying this out eventually. You might want to wait for a few more updates and hopefully the player base will jump up as well, and possibly a sale before buying it. Like I said before, the waiting times can take a while to just get a game going sometimes. 
7/10 Will lurk again

author: {'steamid': '76561197983806340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1423423313}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068064305', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1435676228}
review: Even though this game is very early in development, I highly recommend it! The concept is great. Everyone starts out in the spawn building, and when the round starts, you scavange the environment for food, water, weapons, and ammo. After finding the supplies you need, you start to begin the hunt for other players. Trying to survive is tough enough, but playing offense adds another dimension to this game. This game is truely kill or be killed. Yes it is buggy. Yes the animations are hilarious. But also, yes, this game is fun! And it will only get better!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074768974', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1452367245}
review:
I bought this game for 20 euros, or however much it cost, when it first entered early access. (Obviously I regret that now.) 
I eagerly followed the development, I was all about this game. A Hunger Games style video game with survival elements? F@$k yeah!
I liked it, even when it was buggy and the animations were abysmal. I liked it. 
But as time went on, and the same bugs and s***y animations stayed, the game started to lose is spark in me.

Well now it has "released", and I've come to realize that it never was as good as I made it out to be. It's clunky, glitchy, and barely anyone plays it. I guess we'll just have to wait for something better. Some other game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012512624', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1429924870}
review:
I really like the concept of this game. This is essentially a battle royale standalone. However, the game is very wonky at the moment, which I am sure will get fixed throughout the early access.

Character movement is a little wonky I will admit, it just has this unappealing feel to it. Looking through the cabinets is also a bit strange especially when you look down, it has this odd view to it. 

I managed to play one game so far, as there are very few players at the time, it is very difficult to get into a match. A match seems to require 10 players.

review:
Also ich spiele das Spiel schon seid 20 Std. und muss sagen, ich bin begeistert! 
Am Anfang ist es noch sehr frustrierend, da man Ã¼berhaupt kein Plan hat wo was liegt und was man tun soll und gleich so ein Typ mit ner Axt kommt und dich umhaut.
Doch mit immer mehr Runden die man gespielt hat wird man immer besser und entdeckt viel mehr. 
Trotz vieler Bugs ist das Spiel jetzt schon gut spielbar und macht sehr sehr viel SpaÃŸ.
Das Spiel hat soviel Potential und hat im Moment leider zu wenig Aufmerksamkeit, sodass es ein wenig dauert bis man genÃ¼gend Spieler zusammen hat. Aber dafÃ¼r gibt es auch einen Trick (einfach in den Server rein gehen, get ready drÃ¼cken, dann wieder rausgehen und wieder das gleiche machen. So kriegt man es hin, dass man auch zu zewit spielen kann.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999892157', 'num_games_owned': 1842, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1422726884}
review:
Wow... Ok here we go with my honest first impressions

Waited in a lobby for 22 minutes... went down to 0 people needed, waited 5 more minutes, figured it was bugged and left. Game was closed because it was in progress. Waited another 16 minutes in another lobby finally in ok cool.

Hilariously awful animations aside this is a list of bugs I had in 4 games.

Climbing an invisible ladder into the sky
Eating my food as I pick up a gun unintentionally
Scoped in with snipe makes me fall through the map
Got stuck on the upstairs of a hour because the stairs were too high
latency so bad the one gun fight I get into we both die because we lagged so bad

Bugs aside the map is extremely bland and unappealing, the chacters run like they have dingleberries attached to every hair on their body. The food and water go down so quick it becomes a more of race for survival than an actual competitive fps, you'll spend more time in lobbies than the actual game.

Overall AVOID this like the plague unless you only want to support the devs because this is NOT a fun prodcut in it's current form.

Here is video format of my experience.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OyGFmzIxXKg

author: {'steamid': '76561197997172478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1013, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1452247949}
review:
[h1] Eat,drink - find weapons and kill [/h1].

Wow, it's strange that so much time must have passed for someone to finally use such a great idea as fighting to the death in a closed zone.

In the era of popularity of survival games and the rash of dayZ, warz, h1z1 and a thousand other creations, no one thought to do such a survival but in the light version, where players are locked in an area and have to kill each other - the last one wins. That's what Down To One is.

Locked in an area about the size of a large Battlefield map, we have to survive and kill at the same time. Everyone is gathered in the center of the map in a kind of prison, when the game starts - the cell opens and we run out into the world, where we run depends on us - if we choose a military base we run the risk that someone will come a moment before us, find a gun and kill us, and even if we get there first we still run the risk of running out of food and water - every round means making a decision - is it safer to run to an abandoned hut where we can find provisions and a knife or run to the military base to arm ourselves with a super weapon at the risk of being shot or dying of starvation.

Another factor that makes the game more difficult is the artillery fire and the fact that every few minutes the area of the map in which we can play decreases - which is logical - the fewer players left alive, the closer the barrier is to the center - which forces the player to find new hiding places and the awareness that the barrier will soon decrease, so other players will also run out of their hiding places - to hunt them down or do everything not to be hunted.

To customize the character we have available perks, camouflages, you can have three active, they are divided into categories such as defense, attack, survival, etc. New perks are unlocked through experience, which we get during the game for killing and surviving as long as possible. 

The game in its current alpha version offers one map - but it has something that many other games lack - developers.
Developers who polish the game every day, people who sit on the forum 24/7 write back almost immediately, all the time you can play with developers on the servers, talk and discuss what to add, change and rewrite.
They can even add two patches a day.

Now the drawbacks because every game has them - this is the Alpha as of February 2015 so it's possible that as you read this the problems in question don't exist, but - the current animations which are mega silly weird and funny in their own way relieve the atmosphere and give some laughs while waiting for the opening of the objective - but still they should be more normal. In addition, the game's HUD, which is supposed to be minimalistic, is a big drawback for me.The number of pre-mites and weapons is awfully small for a game of this type.
One simple map and problems with joining the server, because when the game is running you can't even join the waiting room.
I also miss the fact that there is no option for everyone to respawn in a random place on the map - currently everyone is born in the middle and everyone runs in the direction of their choice - it kind of spoils the opportunity to do ambushes, etc. when we see where many people have gone. 

I'm satisfied with this game, it has great potential that can not be wasted, at the moment I would not buy the full price, but in the promotion I would - if the developers really develop it will be a solid competition for Dayz and h1z1

author: {'steamid': '76561198015790280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1686538146}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961397363', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1442096863}
review:
Wer kennt das nicht: Man spielt ne Runde DayZ oder irgend nen anderen Survival Multiplayer Titel, will einfach nur Ã¼berleben und ZACK kommt ein anderer Spieler um die Ecke und jagd dir ne Kugel in den Kopf...Dooof
Wer dagegen der andere Spieler war^^, wird mit Down to One seine Freude haben!
Einfach mal hier reinschauen:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=baUNHQ1LaIU&feature=youtu.be

Wie bei den Hungergames starten alle Spieler zusammen. Wenn die Runde startet heiÃŸt es schnellstmÃ¶glich eine Waffe finden und die anderen Spieler umlegen. Der letzte Ãœberlebende gewinnt! Aber nicht nur die gegnerischen Spieler sind tÃ¶tlich sondern auch Durst und Hunger. Man muss also auch Verpflegung suchen und sich ab und zu verarzten wenn man verletzt wurde.
Momentan ist das spiel in der Version 0,15c , also eine sehr frÃ¼he Version. ICH (ich will fÃ¼r niemanden anderen Sprechen) hatte keine Bugs, kann das Spiel also genieÃŸen. Die Grafik ist in Ordnung, aber eher Indi;) Der sound ist soweit auch ganz gut. Die Steuerung ist teilweise noch etwas hakelig. Insgesamt macht das Spiel einen runden technischen Eindruck. Ich hatte Ã¼brigens KEINE Lags. find ich super! Die Animationen sind noch sehr lustig^^ Aber das wird schon noch^^

Die Runden sind trotz der recht groÃŸen Karte max. 20-25 Minuten lang. Ãœber dem Spielfeld ist ein Energiedome der nach und nach immer kleiner wird. Die Spieler werden also immer dichter zusammengedrÃ¤ngt. Die Action steigt also gegen Ende der Runde.
AuÃŸerdem gibt es noch ein Erfahrungssystem mit Perks. Nach einer Runde gibts XP und man kann im Level aufsteigen. 3 PErks kÃ¶nnen gleichzeitig aktiv sein, z.B. das die Essensanzeige langsamer abnimmt etc. Bin gespannt was da noch so kommen wird
Ich hab meinen SpaÃŸ mit dem Spiel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007928072', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1423658657}
review:
I wish there were a neutral button for these occasions, but since we dont I'll give it the good old thumbs up.

My reasoning for this is quite simply it being still early in the early acces and no more.

http://youtu.be/cjxOfne9Akk

The game is promising and I'm definetly going to play it more as the updates come rolling along, but for the average consumer I'm not sure I should ever recomend an unfinished game.

But if you are a person who enjoys early acces stuff then you shouldn't be worried. There are a lot more awful games on early access out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053422627', 'num_games_owned': 2391, 'num_reviews': 1237, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1452287800}
review:
This game quickly died and saw the price drop to just 99 cents.

The servers are dead now and have been for years.

It was a good idea back in early 2015, made the kid that made this game a load of cash, but like so many asset reliant battle royale games over the years, it quickly died.

The animations were soooo bad, lol.  Half the time you killed someone, you couldn't get their dropped loot.  Just a mess, but hey.. it was a cool idea when it came out.


Have a look at my 2nd game of 'Down To One' ...This was recorded in January of 2015 at launch.  (My video recording software didnt record any voice or game sound so I just added music) :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q1K0gDOOQg4

author: {'steamid': '76561198067326957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1453091336}
review: Well i did start off with posative cos i cant take away the game dose have potential and updates come out quite alot but all that is no good if u dont have players to play it with. The only time people are on this game and playing if u happen to be online when one of the admins run an event apart from that its not even worth opening the game up cos u wont get a game. Also i suggested to the devs to put it on a 50% off sale or somthing to get the game onto the sales page on steam get it more noticed and with a 50% sale i guarantee people will try it cos who dont love a bargain? lol. 10 pound is alot to pay for a game they aint going to be able to play so devs rather than think of the money that can roll in later once u have a fan base first of all get people to buy the game cheaper make it more tempting. I will change this review again if it dose ever get players but for now im keeping it to negative. Devs u need to do somthing before its to late and everyone like myself who like playing give up hope all togeather.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997215678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1423542337}
review:
-Player glitched through the waiting lobby map's window before round started, 

-Player returns with a knife and jumps right back into the server lobby filled with opposing unarmed players.

-Unarmed players headbangs in the air, warning others that danger is here, panic occurs through-out this one little room.

Fucking 11/10, I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048128820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1450338919}
review:
Ever wanted to go hiking in a breathtaking barren desert with your friends? If so this is the game for you! 
But there's a slight twist! Death can be iminent in seconds! The perfect game to teach you how to survive in the desert!
By putting you in the boots of a trained soldier! The perfect touch of realistic survival and 
an endless exploration factor of dirt and rocks! Will you survive in the harsh desert? Or become
a victim of the brutal elements and selfishness of other players? 11/10 best desert explorer of 2015!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065126368', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1434988586}
review:
So far this is a great game! (For me)
Played over 6 or more games now and finished in top 5 of each game.
This is going to be a good game when it's all done!
Can't wait to see what the devs add next:)
The Animations are really funny and I can't stop laughing at them 11/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011397584', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1432093460}
review:
I followed this game for a while, and decided to pop back in and drop a negative review.. If this was based solely on the devs, this game would be a 9/10.

Unfortunately, having paid 15$ original price for this game and attempting to actually play, I can say I need some money back... 

Devs WERE awesome.. But not anymore, they gave up on this one, dropped the price to a 15th of what it originally was..

Idk, but I feel like I was duped a little bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019087088', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1435449605}
review:
Fun game
Indie Graphics: CHECK
Animations: Indie like CHECK
Copy of several other things we have already played CHECK
Needed of updates: CHECK
Playablility: Played 2 matches were enjoyable cant wait to see increase in the development
Server status: Low population of people, very low, probably because it just came out
Server status part 2: Need improved smoothness of game overall CHECK
